children.text: >> Title
>> Heading
c 1
v 1
Blessed is the man who does not walk in the advice of the wicked,
or stand in the pathway with sinners,
or sit in the assembly of mockers.
v 2
But his delight is in the law of Yahweh,
and on his law he meditates day and night.
v 3
He will be like a tree planted by the streams of water
that produces its fruit in its season,
whose leaves do not wither;
whatever he does will prosper.
v 4
The wicked are not so,
but are instead like the chaff that the wind drives away.
v 5
So the wicked will not stand in the judgment,
nor sinners in the assembly of the righteous.
v 6
For Yahweh approves of the way of the righteous,
but the way of the wicked will perish.
c 2
v 1
Why are the nations in turmoil,
and why do the peoples make plots that will fail?
v 2
The kings of the earth take their stand together
and the rulers conspire together
against Yahweh and against his Messiah, saying,
v 3
“Let us tear off the shackles they put on us
and throw off their chains.”
v 4
He who sits in the heavens will sneer at them;
the Lord mocks them.
v 5
Then he will speak to them in his anger
and terrify them in his rage, saying,
v 6
“I myself have anointed my king
on Zion, my holy mountain.”
v 7
I will announce a decree of Yahweh.
He said to me, “You are my son!
This day I have become your father.
v 8
Ask me, and I will give you the nations for your inheritance
and the farthermost regions of the earth for your possession.
v 9
You will break them with an iron rod;
like a jar of a potter, you will smash them to pieces.”
So now, you kings, be warned;
be corrected, you rulers of the earth.
Worship Yahweh in fear
and rejoice with trembling.
Kiss the son or he will be angry with you,
and you will die in the way when his anger burns for just a moment.
How blessed are all those who seek refuge in him.
c 3
A psalm of David, when he fled from Absalom his son.
v 1
Yahweh, how many are my enemies!
Many have risen against me.
v 2
Many say about me,
“There is no help for him from God.”
Selah
v 3
But you, Yahweh, are a shield around me,
my glory, and the one who lifts up my head.
v 4
I lift up my voice to Yahweh,
and he answers me from his holy hill.
Selah
v 5
I lay down and slept;
I awoke, for Yahweh protected me.
v 6
I will not be afraid of the multitudes of people
who have set themselves against me on every side.
v 7
Rise up, Yahweh! Save me, my God!
For you will hit all my enemies on the jaw;
you will break the teeth of the wicked.
v 8
Salvation comes from Yahweh.
May your blessings be on your people.
Selah
c 4
For the chief musician; on stringed instruments. A psalm of David.
v 1
Answer me when I call, God of my righteousness;
give me room when I am hemmed in.
Have mercy on me and listen to my prayer.
v 2
You people, how long will you turn my honor into shame?
How long will you love that which is worthless and seek after lies?
Selah
v 3
But know that Yahweh has set apart the faithful ones for himself.
Yahweh will hear when I call to him.
v 4
Tremble in fear, but do not sin!
Meditate in your heart on your bed and be silent.
Selah
v 5
Offer the sacrifices of righteousness
and put your trust in Yahweh.
v 6
Many say, “Who will show us anything good?”
Yahweh, lift up the light of your face on us.
v 7
You have given my heart more gladness
than others have when their grain and new wine abound.
v 8
It is in peace that I will lie down and sleep,
for you alone, Yahweh, make me safe and secure.
c 5
For the chief musician; with wind instruments. A psalm of David.
v 1
Listen to my call to you, Yahweh;
think about my groanings.
v 2
Listen to the sound of my call, my King and my God,
for it is to you that I pray.
v 3
Yahweh, in the morning you hear my cry;
in the morning I will bring my petition to you and wait expectantly.
v 4
Certainly you are not a God who approves of evil;
evil people will not be your guests.
v 5
The arrogant will not stand in your presence;
you hate all who behave wickedly.
v 6
You will destroy liars;
Yahweh despises violent and deceitful men.
v 7
But as for me, because of your great covenant faithfulness, I will come into your house;
in reverence I will bow down toward your holy temple.
v 8
Oh Lord, lead me in your righteousness because of my enemies;
make your path straight before me.
v 9
For there is no truth in their mouth;
their inward being is wicked;
their throat is an open tomb;
they flatter with their tongue.
Declare them guilty, God;
may their schemes be their downfall!
Drive them out for their many transgressions,
for they have rebelled against you.
But may all those who take refuge in you rejoice;
let them always shout for joy because you defend them;
let them be joyful in you, those who love your name.
For you will bless the righteous, Yahweh;
you will surround them with favor as with a shield.
c 6
For the chief musician; on stringed instruments, set to the Sheminith style. A psalm of David.
v 1
Yahweh, do not rebuke me in your anger
or discipline me in your wrath.
v 2
Have mercy on me, Yahweh, for I am frail;
heal me, Yahweh, for my bones are shaking.
v 3
My soul also is very troubled.
But you, Yahweh—how long will this continue?
v 4
Return, Yahweh! rescue me.
Save me because of your covenant faithfulness!
v 5
For in death there is no remembrance of you.
In Sheol who will give you thanks?
v 6
I am weary with my groaning.
All night I drench my bed with tears;
I wash my couch away with my tears.
v 7
My eyes grow dim from grief;
they grow weak because of all my adversaries.
v 8
Get away from me, all you who practice iniquity;
for Yahweh has heard the sound of my weeping.
v 9
Yahweh has heard my appeal for mercy;
Yahweh has accepted my prayer.
All my enemies will be ashamed and greatly troubled.
They will turn back and be suddenly humiliated.
c 7
A musical composition of David, which he sang to Yahweh concerning the words of Cush the Benjamite.
v 1
Yahweh my God, I take refuge in you!
Save me from all who chase me, and rescue me.
v 2
Otherwise, they will rip me apart like a lion,
tearing me in pieces with no one else able to bring me to safety.
v 3
Yahweh my God, if I have done this,
and there is guilt on my hands—
v 4
if I have done evil to him who was at peace with me,
or senselessly harmed my enemy without cause, then hear my words.
v 5
Then let my enemy pursue my life and overtake me;
let him trample my life to the ground
and lay my honor in the dust.
Selah
v 6
Arise, Yahweh, in your anger;
stand up against the rage of my enemies;
wake up for my sake and carry out the righteous decrees that you have commanded for them.
v 7
The countries are assembled all around you;
take once more your rightful place over them.
v 8
Yahweh, judge the nations;
vindicate me, Yahweh, because I am righteous and innocent, Most High.
v 9
May the evil deeds of the wicked come to an end, but establish the righteous people,
righteous God, you who examine hearts and minds.
My shield comes from God,
the one who saves the upright in heart.
God is a righteous judge,
a God who is indignant each day.
If a person does not repent, God will sharpen his sword
and will prepare his bow for battle.
He prepares to use weapons against him;
he makes his arrows flaming shafts.
Think about the one who is pregnant with wickedness,
who conceives destructive plans, who gives birth to harmful lies.
He digs a pit and hollows it out
and then falls into the hole he has made.
His own destructive plans return to his own head,
for his violence comes down on his own head.
I will give thanks to Yahweh for his justice;
I will sing praise to Yahweh Most High.
c 8
For the chief musician; set to the gittith style. A psalm of David.
v 1
Yahweh our Lord, how magnificent is your name in all the earth,
you who reveal your glory in the heavens above.
v 2
Out of the mouth of babies and infants you have established praise
>> Footnote
because of your enemies,
so that you might silence both the enemy and the avenger.
v 3
When I look up at your heavens, which your fingers have made,
the moon and the stars, which you have set in place,
v 4
Of what importance is the human race that you notice them,
or mankind that you pay attention to them?
v 5
Yet you have made them only a little lower than the heavenly beings
and have crowned them with glory and honor.
v 6
You make him to rule over the works of your hands;
you have put all things under his feet:
v 7
all sheep and oxen,
and even the animals of the field,
v 8
the birds of the heavens, and the fish of the sea,
everything that passes through the currents of the seas.
v 9
Yahweh our Lord,
how magnificent is your name in all the earth!
c 9
For the chief musician; set to Muth Labben style. A psalm of David.
v 1
I will give thanks to Yahweh with my whole heart;
I will tell about all your marvelous deeds.
v 2
I will be glad and rejoice in you;
I will sing praise to your name, Most High!
v 3
When my enemies turn back,
they stumble and perish before you.
v 4
For you have defended my just cause;
you sit on your throne, a righteous judge!
v 5
You rebuked the nations;
you have destroyed the wicked;
you have blotted out their name forever and ever.
v 6
The enemy crumbled like ruins
when you overthrew their cities.
All remembrance of them has perished.
v 7
But Yahweh remains forever;
he has established his throne for justice.
v 8
He will judge the world with righteousness,
and he will execute judgment for the nations with fairness.
v 9
Yahweh also will be a stronghold for the oppressed,
a stronghold in times of trouble.
Those who know your name trust in you,
for you, Yahweh, do not abandon those who seek you.
Sing praises to Yahweh, who rules in Zion;
tell the nations what he has done.
For the God who avenges bloodshed remembers;
he does not forget the cry of the oppressed.
Have mercy on me, Yahweh; see how I am oppressed by those who hate me,
you who can snatch me from the gates of death.
Oh, that I might proclaim all your praise.
In the gates of the daughter of Zion
I will rejoice in your salvation!
The nations have sunk down into the pit that they made;
their feet are caught in the net that they hid.
Yahweh has made himself known; he has executed judgment;
the wicked is ensnared by his own actions.
Selah
The wicked are turned back and sent to Sheol,
all the nations that forget God.
For the needy will not always be forgotten,
nor will the hope of the oppressed be forever dashed.
Arise, Yahweh; do not let man win against you;
may the nations be judged in your sight.
Terrify them, Yahweh;
may the nations know that they are mere men.
Selah
v 1
Why, Yahweh, do you stand far off?
Why do you hide yourself in times of trouble?
v 2
Because of their arrogance, wicked people chase the oppressed;
but please let the wicked be trapped by their own schemes that they have devised.
v 3
For the wicked person boasts of his deepest desires;
he blesses the greedy and insults Yahweh.
v 4
The wicked man has a raised face; he does not seek God.
He never thinks about God because he does not care at all about him.
v 5
He is secure at all times,
but your righteous decrees are too high for him;
he snorts at all his enemies.
v 6
He says in his heart,” I will never fail;
throughout all generations I will not meet adversity.”
v 7
His mouth is full of curses and lies and oppression;
under his tongue are mischief and evil.
v 8
He waits in ambush near the villages;
in the secret places he murders the innocent;
his eyes look for some helpless victim.
v 9
He lurks in secret like a lion in the thicket;
he lies in wait to catch the oppressed.
He catches the oppressed when he pulls in his net.
His victims are crushed and beaten down;
they fall into his strong nets.
He says in his heart, “God has forgotten;
he covers his face; he will not bother to look.”
Arise, Yahweh! Lift up your hand, God!
Do not forget the oppressed.
Why does the wicked man reject God
and say in his heart, “You will not hold me accountable”?
You have taken notice, for you always see the one who inflicts the misery and sorrow.
The helpless entrusts himself to you;
you rescue the fatherless.
Break the arm of the wicked and evil man.
Make him account for his evil deeds,
which he thought you would not discover.
Yahweh is King forever and ever;
the nations are driven out of his land.
Yahweh, you have heard the needs of the oppressed;
you strengthen their heart, you listen to their prayer;
You defend the fatherless and the oppressed
so that no man on the earth will cause terror again.
For the chief musician. A psalm of David.
v 1
I take refuge in Yahweh;
how will you say to me,
“Flee like a bird to the mountain”?
v 2
For see! The wicked prepare their bows.
They make ready their arrows on the strings
to shoot in the darkness at the upright in heart.
v 3
For if the foundations are ruined,
what can the righteous do?
v 4
Yahweh is in his holy temple;
his eyes watch, his eyes examine the children of mankind.
v 5
Yahweh examines both the righteous and the wicked,
but he hates those who love to do violence.
v 6
He rains burning coals and brimstone upon the wicked;
a scorching wind will be their portion from his cup!
v 7
For Yahweh is righteous, and he loves righteousness;
the upright will see his face.
For the chief musician; set to the Sheminith. A psalm of David.
v 1
Help, Yahweh, for the faithful ones have disappeared;
those who have integrity have vanished from the children of men.
v 2
Everyone says empty words to his neighbor;
everyone speaks with flattering lips and a double heart.
v 3
Yahweh, cut off all flattering lips,
every tongue declaring great things.
v 4
These are those who have said, “With our tongues will we prevail.
When our lips speak, who can be master over us?”
v 5
“Because of violence against the poor, because of the groans of the needy,
I will arise,” says Yahweh.
“I will provide the safety for which they long.”
v 6
The words of Yahweh are pure words,
like silver purified in a furnace on the earth,
refined seven times.
v 7
You are Yahweh! You keep them.
You preserve the godly people from this wicked generation and forever.
v 8
The wicked walk on every side
when evil is exalted among the children of mankind.
For the chief musician. A psalm of David.
v 1
How long, Yahweh, will you keep forgetting about me?
How long will you hide your face from me?
v 2
How long must I worry
and have grief in my heart all day?
How long will my enemy triumph over me?
v 3
Look at me and answer me, Yahweh my God!
Give light to my eyes, or I will sleep in death.
v 4
Do not let my enemy say, “I have defeated him,”
so that my enemy may not say, “I have prevailed over my adversary”; otherwise, my enemies will rejoice when I am brought down.
v 5
But I have trusted in your covenant faithfulness;
my heart rejoices in your salvation.
v 6
I will sing to Yahweh
because he has treated me very generously.
For the chief musician. A psalm of David.
v 1
A fool says in his heart, “There is no God.”
They are corrupt and have done abominable iniquity;
there is no one who does good.
v 2
Yahweh looks down from heaven on the children of mankind
to see if there are any who understand,
who seek after him.
v 3
They have all turned away. Together they have become corrupt.
There is no one who does good, no, not one.
v 4
Do they not know anything, those who commit iniquity,
those who eat up my people as they eat bread,
but who do not call on Yahweh?
v 5
They tremble with dread,
for God is with the righteous assembly!
v 6
You want to humiliate the poor person
even though Yahweh is his refuge.
v 7
Oh, that the salvation of Israel would come from Zion!
When Yahweh brings back his people from the captivity,
then Jacob will rejoice and Israel will be glad!
A psalm of David.
v 1
Yahweh, who may stay in your tabernacle?
Who may live on your holy hill?
v 2
Whoever walks blamelessly, does what is right
and speaks truth from his heart.
v 3
He does not slander with his tongue,
he does not harm others,
and he does not insult his neighbor.
v 4
The worthless person is despised in his eyes,
but he honors those who fear Yahweh.
He swears to his own disadvantage and does not take back his promises.
v 5
He does not charge interest when he lends money.
He does not take bribes to testify against the innocent.
He who does these things will never be shaken.
A michtam of David.
v 1
Protect me, God, for I take refuge in you.
v 2
I say to Yahweh, “You are my Lord; my goodness is nothing apart from you.
v 3
As for the holy people who are on the earth, they are noble people; all my delight is in them.
v 4
Their troubles will be increased, those who seek out other gods. I will not pour out drink offerings of blood to their gods
or lift up their names with my lips.
v 5
Yahweh, you are my chosen portion and my cup. You hold onto my lot.
v 6
Measuring lines have been laid for me in pleasant places; surely a pleasing inheritance is mine.
v 7
I will bless Yahweh, who counsels me; even at night my mind instructs me.
v 8
I set Yahweh before me at all times, so I will not be shaken from his right hand!
v 9
Therefore my heart is glad; my glory is rejoicing. Surely I will live in security.
For you will not abandon my soul to Sheol. You will not let your faithful one see the pit.
You teach me the path of life; abundant joy resides in your presence; delights abide in your right hand forever!”
A prayer of David.
v 1
Listen to my plea for justice, Yahweh; pay attention to my call for help!
Give ear to my prayer from lips without deceit.
v 2
Let my vindication come from your presence; let your eyes see what is right!
v 3
If you test my heart, if you come to me in the night,
you will purify me and will not find any evil plans; my mouth will not transgress.
v 4
As for the deeds of mankind, it is at the word of your lips that I have kept myself from the ways of the lawless.
v 5
My steps have held firmly to your tracks; my feet have not slipped.
v 6
I call to you, for you answer me, God; turn your ear to me and listen when I speak.
v 7
Show your covenant faithfulness in a wonderful way, you who save by your right hand those who take refuge in you from their enemies!
v 8
Protect me like the apple of your eye; hide me under the shadow of your wings
v 9
from the presence of the wicked ones who assault me, my enemies who surround me.
They have no mercy on anyone; their mouths speak with pride.
They have surrounded my steps. They set their eyes to strike me to the ground.
They are like a lion eager for a victim, like a young lion crouching in hidden places.
Arise, Yahweh! Attack them! Throw them down on their faces! Rescue my life from the wicked by your sword!
Rescue me from men by your hand, Yahweh, from men of this world whose prosperity is in this life alone!
You will fill the bellies of your treasured ones with riches; they will have many children and will leave their wealth to their children.
As for me, I will see your face in righteousness; I will be satisfied, when I awake, with a sight of you.

For the chief musician. A psalm of David, the servant of Yahweh, when he sang to Yahweh the words of this song on the day that Yahweh rescued him from the hand of all his enemies and from the hand of Saul. He sang:
v 1
I love you, Yahweh, my strength.
v 2
Yahweh is my rock, my fortress, the one who brings me to safety; he is my God, my rock; I take refuge in him.
He is my shield, the horn of my salvation, and my stronghold.
v 3
I will call on Yahweh who is worthy to be praised, and I will be saved from my enemies.
v 4
The cords of death surrounded me, and the rushing waters of worthlessness overwhelmed me.
v 5
The cords of Sheol surrounded me; the snares of death trapped me.
v 6
In my distress I called to Yahweh; I called for help to my God. He heard my voice from his temple;
my call for help went into his presence; it went into his ears.
v 7
Then the earth shook and trembled; the foundations of the mountains also trembled
and were shaken because God was angry.
v 8
Smoke went up from out of his nostrils, and blazing fire came out of his mouth. Coals were ignited by it.
v 9
He opened the heavens and came down, and thick darkness was under his feet.
He rode on a cherub and flew; he glided on the wings of the wind.
He made darkness a tent around him, heavy rainclouds in the skies.
Hailstones and coals of fire fell from the lightning before him.
Yahweh thundered in the heavens! The voice of the Most High shouted.
>> Footnote
He shot his arrows and scattered his enemies; many lightning bolts dispersed them.
Then the water channels appeared;
the foundations of the world were laid bare
at your rebuke, Yahweh,
at the blast of the breath of your nostrils.
He reached down from above; he took hold of me! He pulled me out of the surging water.
He rescued me from my strong enemy, from those who hated me, for they were too strong for me.
They came against me on the day of my distress but Yahweh was my support!
He set me free in a wide open place; he saved me because he was pleased with me.
Yahweh has rewarded me because of my righteousness; he has restored me because my hands were clean.
For I have kept the ways of Yahweh and have not wickedly turned away from my God.
For all his righteous decrees have been before me; as for his statutes, I have not turned away from them.
I have also been innocent before him, and I have kept myself from sin.
Therefore Yahweh has restored me because of my righteousness, because my hands were clean before his eyes.
To the one who is faithful, you show yourself to be faithful;
to a man who is blameless, you show yourself to be blameless.
To anyone who is pure, you show yourself pure; but you are clever toward anyone who is twisted.
For you save afflicted people, but you bring down those with proud, uplifted eyes!
For you give light to my lamp; Yahweh my God lights up my darkness.
For by you I can run over a barricade; by my God I can leap over a wall.
As for God—his way is perfect! The word of Yahweh is pure!
He is a shield to everyone who takes refuge in him.
For who is God except Yahweh? Who is a rock except our God?
It is God who puts strength on me like a belt, who places the blameless person on his path.
He makes my feet swift like a deer and places me on the heights!
He trains my hands for war and my arms to bend a bow of bronze.
You have given me the shield of your salvation. Your right hand has supported me, and your favor has made me great.
You have made a wide place for my feet beneath me so that my feet have not slipped.
I pursued my enemies and caught them; I did not turn back until they were destroyed.
I smashed them so that they were unable to rise; they have fallen under my feet.
For you put strength on me like a belt for battle; you put under me those who rise up against me.
You gave me the back of my enemies’ necks; I annihilated those who hated me.
They called for help, but no one saved them; they called out to Yahweh, but he did not answer them.
I beat them into fine pieces like dust before the wind; I threw them out like mud in the streets.
You rescued me from the disputes of people. You have made me the head over nations. People that I have not known serve me.
As soon as they heard of me, they obeyed me; foreigners were forced to bow to me.
The foreigners came trembling out of their strongholds.
Yahweh lives; may my rock be praised. May the God of my salvation be exalted.
He is the God who executes vengeance for me, who subdues the nations under me.
I am set free from my enemies! Indeed, you lifted me above the ones who rose against me! You rescued me from violent men.
Therefore I will give thanks to you, Yahweh, among the nations; I will sing praises to your name!
God gives great victory to his king, and he shows his covenant loyalty to his anointed one, to David and to his descendants forever.
For the chief musician. A psalm of David.
v 1
The heavens declare the glory of God,
and the skies make his handiwork known!
v 2
Day after day speech pours out;
night after night it reveals knowledge.
v 3
There is no speech or spoken words;
their voice is not heard.
v 4
Yet their words go out over all the earth,
and their speech to the end of the world.
He has pitched a tent for the sun among them.
v 5
The sun is like a bridegroom coming out of his chamber
and like a strong man who rejoices when he runs his race.
v 6
The sun rises from the one horizon
and crosses the sky to the other;
nothing escapes its heat.
v 7
The law of Yahweh is perfect, restoring the soul;
the testimony of Yahweh is reliable, making the simple wise.
v 8
The instructions of Yahweh are right, making the heart glad;
the commandment of Yahweh is pure, bringing light to the eyes.
v 9
The fear of Yahweh is pure, enduring forever;
the righteous decrees of Yahweh are true and altogether right!
They are of greater value than gold, even more than much fine gold;
they are sweeter than honey and the dripping honey from the honeycomb.
Yes, by them your servant is warned;
in obeying them there is great reward.
Who can discern all his own errors?
Cleanse me from hidden faults.
Keep your servant also from arrogant sins;
let them not rule over me.
Then I will be perfect,
and I will be innocent from many transgressions.
May the words of my mouth and the thoughts of my heart
be acceptable in your sight,
Yahweh, my rock and my redeemer.
For the chief musician. A psalm of David.
v 1
May Yahweh help you in the day of trouble;
may the name of the God of Jacob protect you
v 2
and send help from the holy place
to support you from Zion.
v 3
May he call to mind all your offerings
and accept your burnt sacrifice.
Selah
v 4
May he grant you your heart’s desire
and fulfill all your plans.
v 5
Then we will rejoice in your victory,
and, in the name of our God, we will raise banners.
May Yahweh grant all your petitions.
v 6
Now I know that Yahweh will rescue his anointed one;
he will answer him from his holy heaven
with the strength of his right hand that can rescue him.
v 7
Some trust in chariots and others in horses,
but we call on Yahweh our God.
v 8
They will be brought down and fall,
but we will rise and stand upright!
v 9
Yahweh, rescue the king;
help us when we call.
For the chief musician. A psalm of David.
v 1
The king rejoices in your strength, Yahweh!
How greatly he rejoices in the salvation you provide!
v 2
You have given him his heart’s desire
and have not held back the request of his lips.
Selah
v 3
For you bring him rich blessings;
you placed on his head a crown of purest gold.
v 4
He asked you for life; you gave it to him;
you gave him the length of his days forever and ever.
v 5
His glory is great because of your victory;
you have bestowed on him splendor and majesty.
v 6
For you grant him lasting blessings;
you make him glad with the joy of your presence.
v 7
For the king trusts in Yahweh;
through the covenant faithfulness of the Most High he will not be moved.
v 8
Your hand will seize all your enemies;
your right hand will seize those who hate you.
v 9
At the time of your anger, you will burn them up as in a fiery furnace.
Yahweh will consume them in his wrath,
and the fire will devour them.
You will destroy their offspring from the earth
and their descendants from among the human race.
For they intended evil against you;
they conceived a plot with which they will not succeed!
For you will turn them back;
you will draw your bow before them.
Be exalted, Yahweh, in your strength;
we will sing and praise your power.
For the chief musician; set to “The rhythm of the deer.” A psalm of David.
v 1
My God, my God, why have you abandoned me?
Why are you so far from saving me and far from the words of my anguish?
v 2
My God, I cry out in the daytime, but you do not answer,
and at night I am not silent!
v 3
Yet you are holy;
you sit as king with the praises of Israel.
v 4
Our ancestors trusted in you;
they trusted in you, and you rescued them.
v 5
They cried to you and they were rescued.
They trusted in you and were not disappointed.
v 6
But I am a worm and not a man,
a disgrace to humanity and despised by the people.
v 7
All those who see me taunt me;
they mock me; they shake their heads at me.
v 8
They say, “He trusts in Yahweh;
let Yahweh rescue him.
Let him rescue him, for he delights in him.”
v 9
For you brought me from the womb;
you made me trust you when I was on my mother’s breasts.
I have been thrown on you from the womb;
you are my God since I was in my mother’s womb!
Do not be far away from me, for trouble is near;
there is no one to help.
Many bulls surround me;
strong bulls of Bashan surround me.
They open their mouths wide against me
like a roaring lion ripping its victim.
I am being poured out like water,
and all my bones are dislocated.
My heart is like wax;
it melts away within my inner parts.
My strength has dried up like a piece of pottery;
my tongue sticks to the roof of my mouth.
You have laid me in the dust of death.
For dogs have surrounded me;
a company of evildoers has encircled me;
they have pierced my hands and my feet.
I can count all my bones.
They look and stare at me.
They divide my garments among themselves,
they cast lots for my clothes.
Do not be far away, Yahweh;
please hurry to help me, my strength!
Rescue my soul from the sword,
my only life from the claws of wild dogs.
Save me from the lion’s mouth;
rescue me from the horns of the wild oxen.
I will declare your name to my brothers;
in the midst of the assembly I will praise you.
You who fear Yahweh, praise him!
All you descendants of Jacob, honor him!
Stand in awe of him, all you descendants of Israel!
For he has not despised or abhorred the suffering of the afflicted one;
Yahweh has not hidden his face from him;
when the afflicted one cried to him, he heard.
My praise will be because of you in the great assembly;
I will fulfill my vows before those who fear him.
The oppressed will eat and be satisfied;
those who seek Yahweh will praise him.
May your hearts live forever.
All the peoples of the earth will remember and turn to Yahweh;
all the families of the nations will bow down before you.
For the kingdom is Yahweh’s;
he is the ruler over the nations.
All the prosperous people of the earth will feast and will worship;
all those who are descending into the dust will bow before him,
those who cannot preserve their own lives.
A generation to come will serve him;
they will tell the next generation of the Lord.
They will come and tell of his righteousness;
they will tell to a people not yet born what he has done!
A psalm of David.
v 1
Yahweh is my shepherd; I will lack nothing.
v 2
He makes me to lie down in green pastures;
he leads me beside tranquil water.
v 3
He brings back my life;
he guides me along right paths for his name’s sake.
v 4
Even though I walk through a valley of darkest shadow,
I will not fear harm since you are with me;
your rod and your staff comfort me.
v 5
You prepare a table before me in the presence of my enemies;
you have anointed my head with oil;
my cup runs over.
v 6
Surely goodness and covenant faithfulness will pursue me all the days of my life;
and I will live in the house of Yahweh for the length of my days!
A psalm of David.
v 1
The earth is Yahweh’s, and its fullness,
the world, and all who live in it.
v 2
For he has founded it upon the seas
and established it on the rivers.
v 3
Who will ascend the mountain of Yahweh?
Who will stand in his holy place?
v 4
He who has clean hands and a pure heart;
who has not lifted up a falsehood,
and has not sworn an oath in order to deceive.
v 5
He will receive a blessing from Yahweh
and righteousness from the God of his salvation.
v 6
Such is the generation of those who seek him,
those who seek the face of the God of Jacob.
Selah
v 7
Lift up your heads, you gates;
be lifted up, everlasting doors,
so that the King of glory may come in!
v 8
Who is this King of glory?
Yahweh, strong and mighty; Yahweh, mighty in battle.
v 9
Lift up your heads, you gates;
be lifted up, everlasting doors,
so that the King of glory may come in!
Who is this King of glory?
Yahweh of hosts,
he is the King of glory.
Selah
A psalm of David.
v 1
To you, Yahweh, I lift up my life!
v 2
My God, I trust in you.
Do not let me be humiliated;
do not let my enemies rejoice triumphantly over me.
v 3
May no one who hopes in you be disgraced
may those who act treacherously without cause be ashamed!
v 4
Make known to me your ways, Yahweh;
teach me your paths.
v 5
Guide me into your truth and teach me,
for you are the God of my salvation;
I hope in you all day long.
v 6
Call to mind, Yahweh, your acts of compassion and of covenant faithfulness;
for they have always existed.
v 7
Do not think about the sins of my youth or my rebelliousness;
Call me to mind with covenant faithfulness because of your goodness, Yahweh!
v 8
Yahweh is good and upright;
therefore he teaches sinners the way.
v 9
He guides the humble in what is right
and he teaches them his way.
All the paths of Yahweh are steadfast love and faithfulness
to those who keep his covenant and his solemn commands.
For your name’s sake, Yahweh,
pardon my sin, for it is great.
Who is the man who fears Yahweh?
The Lord will instruct him in the way that he should choose.
His life will go along in goodness;
and his descendants will inherit the land.
The friendship of Yahweh is for those who honor him,
and he makes his covenant known to them.
My eyes are always on Yahweh,
for he will free my feet from the net.
Turn toward me and have mercy on me;
for I am alone and afflicted.
The troubles of my heart are enlarged;
draw me out from my distress!
See my affliction and my toils;
forgive all my sins.
See my enemies, for they are many;
they hate me with cruel hatred.
Protect my life and rescue me;
do not let me be humiliated, for I take refuge in you!
May integrity and uprightness preserve me,
for I hope in you.
Rescue Israel, God,
from all of his troubles!
A psalm of David.
v 1
Judge me, Yahweh, for I have walked with integrity;
I have trusted in Yahweh without wavering.
v 2
Examine me, Yahweh, and test me;
test the purity of my inner parts and my heart!
v 3
For your covenant faithfulness is before my eyes,
and I walk about in your faithfulness.
v 4
I do not associate with deceitful people,
nor do I mingle with dishonest people.
v 5
I hate the assembly of evildoers,
and I do not live with the wicked.
v 6
I wash my hands in innocence,
and I go around your altar, Yahweh,
v 7
to sing a loud song of praise
and report all your wonderful deeds.
v 8
Yahweh, I love the house where you live,
the place where your glory lives!
v 9
Do not sweep me away with sinners,
or my life with people who are bloodthirsty,
in whose hands there is a plot,
and whose right hand is full of bribes.
But as for me, I will walk in integrity;
redeem me and have mercy on me.
My foot stands on level ground;
in the assemblies will I bless Yahweh!
A psalm of David.
v 1
Yahweh is my light and my salvation;
whom should I fear?
Yahweh is my life’s refuge;
whom should I dread?
v 2
When evildoers approached me to devour my flesh,
my adversaries and my enemies stumbled and fell.
v 3
Though an army encamps against me,
my heart will not fear;
though war rises up against me,
even then I will remain confident.
v 4
One thing have I asked of Yahweh, and I will seek that:
that I may live in the house of Yahweh all the days of my life,
to see the beauty of Yahweh
and to meditate in his temple.
v 5
For in the day of trouble he will hide me in his shelter;
in the cover of his tent he will conceal me.
He will lift me high on a rock!
v 6
Then my head will be lifted up above my enemies all around me,
and I will offer sacrifices of joy in his tent!
I will sing and make songs to Yahweh!
v 7
Hear, Yahweh, my voice when I cry out!
Have mercy on me, and answer me!
v 8
My heart says about you,
“Seek his face!” I seek your face, Yahweh!
v 9
Do not hide your face from me;
do not turn your servant away in anger!
You have been my helper;
do not forsake me or abandon me, God of my salvation!
Even if my father and my mother forsake me,
Yahweh will take me in.
Teach me your way, Yahweh!
Lead me on a level path
because of my enemies.
Do not give me up to the desires of my enemies,
for false witnesses have risen up against me,
and they breathe out violence!
What would have happened to me if I had not believed that I would see the goodness of Yahweh in the land of the living?
Wait for Yahweh;
be strong, and let your heart be courageous!
Wait for Yahweh!
A psalm of David.
v 1
To you, Yahweh, I cry out; my rock, do not ignore me.
If you do not respond to me, I will join those who go down to the grave.
v 2
Hear the sound of my pleading when I call for help from you,
when I lift up my hands toward your most holy place!
v 3
Do not drag me away with the wicked, those who do iniquity,
who speak peace with their neighbors but have evil in their hearts.
v 4
Give them what their deeds deserve and repay them what their wickedness demands,
repay them for the work of their hands and render to them their due.
v 5
Because they do not understand the deeds of Yahweh or the work of his hands,
he will tear them down and never rebuild them.
v 6
Blessed be Yahweh
because he has heard the sound of my pleading!
v 7
Yahweh is my strength and my shield;
my heart trusts in him, and I am helped.
Therefore my heart greatly rejoices,
and I will praise him with singing.
v 8
Yahweh is the strength of his people,
and he is the saving refuge of his anointed one.
v 9
Save your people and bless your inheritance.
Be their shepherd and carry them forever.
A psalm of David.
v 1
Ascribe to Yahweh, you sons of God,
ascribe to Yahweh glory and strength!
v 2
Ascribe to Yahweh the glory his name deserves.
Bow down to Yahweh in the splendor of holiness!
v 3
The voice of Yahweh is heard over the waters;
the God of glory thunders,
Yahweh thunders over many waters.
v 4
The voice of Yahweh is powerful;
the voice of Yahweh is majestic.
v 5
The voice of Yahweh breaks the cedars;
Yahweh breaks in pieces the cedars of Lebanon.
v 6
He makes Lebanon skip like a calf
and Sirion like a young ox.
v 7
The voice of Yahweh sends out flames of fire.
v 8
The voice of Yahweh shakes the wilderness;
Yahweh shakes the wilderness of Kadesh.
v 9
The voice of Yahweh causes the oaks to twist
and strips the forests bare.
Everyone in his temple says, “Glory!”
Yahweh sits as king over the flood;
Yahweh sits as king forever.
Yahweh gives strength to his people;
Yahweh blesses his people with peace.
A psalm; a song at the dedication of the temple. A psalm of David.
v 1
I will exalt you, Yahweh, for you have raised me up and have not allowed my enemies to rejoice over me.
v 2
Yahweh my God, I cried to you for help, and you healed me.
v 3
Yahweh, you have brought up my soul from Sheol; you have kept me alive from going down to the grave.
v 4
Sing praises to Yahweh, you his faithful ones! Give thanks when you remember his holiness.
v 5
For his anger is only for a moment; but his favor is for a lifetime.
Weeping comes for a night, but joy comes in the morning.
v 6
In confidence I said, “I will never be shaken.”
v 7
Yahweh, by your favor you established me as a strong mountain; but when you hid your face, I was troubled.
v 8
I cried to you, Yahweh, and sought favor from my Lord!
v 9
What advantage is there in my death, if I go down to the grave? Will the dust praise you? Will it declare your trustworthiness?
Hear, Yahweh, and have mercy on me! Yahweh, be my helper.
You have turned my mourning into dancing; you have removed my sackcloth and clothed me with gladness.
So now my glory will sing praise to you and not be silent; Yahweh my God, I will give thanks to you forever!
For the chief musician. A psalm of David.
v 1
In you, Yahweh, I take refuge;
never let me be humiliated.
Rescue me in your righteousness.
v 2
Listen to me; rescue me quickly;
be my rock of refuge,
a stronghold to save me.
v 3
For you are my rock and my fortress;
therefore for your name’s sake, lead and guide me.
v 4
Pluck me out of the net that they have hidden for me,
for you are my refuge.
v 5
Into your hands I entrust my spirit;
you will redeem me, Yahweh, God of trustworthiness.
v 6
I hate those who serve worthless idols,
but I trust in Yahweh.
v 7
I will be glad and rejoice in your covenant faithfulness,
for you saw my affliction;
you knew the distress of my soul.
v 8
You have not given me into the hand of my enemy.
You have set my feet in a wide open place.
v 9
Have mercy upon me, Yahweh, for I am in distress;
my eyes grow weary with grief with my soul and my body.
For my life is weary with sorrow
and my years with groaning.
My strength fails because of my sin,
and my bones are wasting away.
Because of all my enemies, people disdain me;
my neighbors are appalled at my situation,
and those who know me are horrified.
Those who see me in the street run from me.
I am forgotten as a dead man whom no one thinks about.
I am like a broken pot.
For I have heard the whispering of many,
terrifying news from every side
as they plot together against me.
They plot to take away my life.
But I trust in you, Yahweh;
I say, “You are my God.”
My times are in your hand.
Rescue me from the hands of my enemies and from those who pursue me.
Make your face shine on your servant;
save me in your covenant faithfulness.
Do not let me be humiliated, Yahweh; for I call out to you!
May the wicked be humiliated! May they be silent in Sheol.
May lying lips be silenced
that speak against the righteous defiantly
with arrogance and contempt.
How great is your goodness
that you have stored up for those who revere you,
that you perform for those who take refuge in you
before all the children of mankind!
In the shelter of your presence, you hide them from the plots of men.
You hide them in a shelter from the violence of tongues.
Blessed be Yahweh,
for he showed me his marvelous covenant faithfulness when I was in a besieged city.
Though I said in my haste,
“I am cut off from your eyes,”
yet you heard my plea for help
when I cried to you.
Love Yahweh, all you faithful ones.
Yahweh protects the faithful,
but he pays back the arrogant in full.
Be strong and confident,
all you who trust in Yahweh for help.
A psalm of David. A maschil.
v 1
Blessed is the person whose transgression is forgiven,
whose sin is covered.
v 2
Blessed is the man to whom Yahweh reckons no guilt
and in whose spirit there is no deceit.
v 3
When I remained silent, my bones were wasting away
while I groaned all day long.
v 4
For day and night your hand was heavy upon me.
My strength withered as in summer drought.
Selah
v 5
Then I acknowledged my sin to you,
and I no longer hid my iniquity.
I said, “I will confess my transgressions to Yahweh,”
and you forgave the guilt of my sin.
Selah
v 6
For this reason every one of your faithful followers should pray to you at a time of great distress.
When the surging waters overflow, the waters will not reach them.
v 7
You are my hiding place; you will guard me from trouble.
You will surround me with the songs of victory.
Selah
v 8
I will instruct you and teach you in the way which you should go.
I will instruct you with my eye upon you.
v 9
Do not be like a horse or like a mule, which have no understanding;
it is only with bridle and bit to control them
that they will go where you want them to.
The wicked have many sorrows,
but Yahweh’s covenant faithfulness will surround the one who trusts in him.
Be glad in Yahweh, and rejoice, you righteous;
shout for joy, all you who are upright in heart.
v 1
Rejoice in Yahweh, you righteous;
praise is appropriate for the upright.
v 2
Give thanks to Yahweh with the harp;
sing praises to him with the harp of ten strings.
v 3
Sing to him a new song;
play skillfully and sing with joy.
v 4
For Yahweh’s word is upright,
and everything he does is fair.
v 5
He loves righteousness and justice.
The earth is full of Yahweh’s covenant faithfulness.
v 6
By the word of Yahweh the heavens were made,
and all the stars were made by the breath of his mouth.
v 7
He gathers the waters of the sea together like a heap;
he puts the oceans in storehouses.
v 8
Let the whole earth fear Yahweh;
let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of him.
v 9
For he spoke, and it was done;
he commanded, and it stood in place.
Yahweh frustrates the alliances of nations;
he overrules the plans of the peoples.
The plans of Yahweh stand forever,
the plans of his heart for all generations.
Blessed is the nation whose God is Yahweh,
the people whom he has chosen as his own inheritance.
Yahweh looks from heaven;
he sees all the people.
From the place where he lives,
he looks down on all who live on the earth.
He who shapes the hearts of them all
observes all their deeds.
No king is saved by a vast army;
a warrior is not saved by his great strength.
A horse is a false hope for victory;
in spite of his great strength, he cannot rescue.
See, Yahweh’s eye is on those who fear him,
on those who hope in his covenant faithfulness
to deliver their lives from death
and to keep them alive in times of famine.
We wait for Yahweh;
he is our help and our shield.
Our hearts rejoice in him,
for we trust in his holy name.
Let your covenant faithfulness, Yahweh, be with us
as we put our hope in you.
A psalm of David; when he pretended to be insane before Abimelech, who drove him out.
v 1
I will praise Yahweh at all times,
his praise will always be in my mouth.
v 2
I will praise Yahweh!
May the oppressed hear and rejoice.
v 3
Praise Yahweh with me,
let us lift up his name together.
v 4
I sought Yahweh and he answered me,
and he gave me victory over all my fears.
v 5
Those who look to him are radiant,
and their faces are not ashamed.
v 6
This oppressed man cried and Yahweh heard him
and saved him from all his troubles.
v 7
The angel of Yahweh camps around those who fear him
and rescues them.
v 8
Taste and see that Yahweh is good.
Blessed is the man who takes refuge in him.
v 9
Fear Yahweh, you his holy people.
There is no lack for those who fear him.
The young lions sometimes lack food and suffer hunger,
but those who seek Yahweh will not lack anything good.
Come, sons, listen to me.
I will teach you the fear of Yahweh.
What man is there who desires life
and loves many days,
that he may see good?
Then keep your tongue from evil
and keep your lips from speaking lies.
Turn away from evil and do good.
Seek peace and go after it.
The eyes of Yahweh are on the righteous
and his ears are directed toward their cry.
The face of Yahweh is against those who do evil,
to cut off the memory of them from the earth.
The righteous cry out and Yahweh hears
and he rescues them from all their troubles.
Yahweh is close to the brokenhearted,
and he saves those who are crushed in spirit.
Many are the troubles of the righteous,
but Yahweh delivers them out of them all.
He keeps all his bones,
not one of them will be broken.
Evil will kill the wicked.
Those who hate the righteous will be condemned.
Yahweh rescues the lives of his servants.
None of those who take refuge in him will be condemned.
A psalm of David.
v 1
Yahweh, work against those who work against me;
fight against those who fight against me.
v 2
Grab your small shield and large shield;
rise up and help me.
v 3
Use your spear and battle ax against those who chase me;
say to my soul, “I am your salvation.”
v 4
May those who seek my life be shamed and dishonored.
May those who plan to harm me be turned back and confounded.
v 5
May they be as chaff before the wind,
as the angel of Yahweh drives them away.
v 6
May their way be dark and slippery,
as the angel of Yahweh chases them.
v 7
Without cause they set their net for me;
without cause they dug a pit for my life.
v 8
Let destruction overtake them by surprise.
Let the net that they have set catch them.
Let them fall into it, to their destruction.
v 9
But I will be joyful in Yahweh
and rejoice in his salvation.
All my bones will say, “Yahweh, who is like you,
who rescues the oppressed from those who are too strong for them
and the poor and needy from those who try to rob them?”
Unrighteous witnesses rise up;
they accuse me falsely.
They repay me evil for good.
I am sorrowful.
But, when they were sick, I wore sackcloth;
I fasted for them
with my head bowed on my chest.
I went about in grief as for my brother;
I bent down in mourning as for my mother.
But when I stumbled, they rejoiced and gathered together;
they gathered together against me, and I was surprised by them.
They tore at me without stopping.
With no respect at all they mocked me;
they grind their teeth at me in rage.
Lord, how long will you look on?
Rescue my soul from their destructive attacks,
my life from the lions.
Then I will thank you in the great assembly;
I will praise you among many people.
Do not let my deceitful enemies rejoice over me;
do not let them carry out their wicked schemes.
For they do not speak peace,
but they devise deceitful words against those in our land who live in peace.
They open their mouths wide against me;
they said, “Aha, Aha, our eyes have seen it.”
You have seen it, Yahweh, do not be silent;
Lord, do not be far from me.
Arouse yourself and awake to my defense;
My God and my Lord, defend my cause.
Defend me, Yahweh my God, because of your righteousness;
do not let them rejoice over me.
Do not let them say in their heart, “Aha, we have what we wanted.”
Do not let them say, “We have devoured him.”
May they be put to shame and may they be confounded who rejoice at my distress.
May those who exalt themselves over me be clothed with shame and dishonor.
Let those who desire my vindication shout for joy and be glad;
may they say continually, “Yahweh be praised,
he who delights in the welfare of his servant.”
Then I will tell of your justice
and praise you all day long.
For the chief musician. A psalm of David the servant of Yahweh.
v 1
An evil man speaks of his transgression from deep in his heart,
there is no fear of God in his eyes.
v 2
For he comforts himself,
thinking that his sin will not be discovered and be hated.
v 3
His words are sinful and deceitful;
he does not want to be wise and do good.
v 4
While he lies in bed, he plans ways to sin;
he sets out on an evil way;
he does not reject evil.
v 5
Your covenant faithfulness, Yahweh, reaches to the heavens;
your loyalty reaches to the clouds.
v 6
Your righteousness is like the mountains of God;
your judgments are like the great deep.
Yahweh, you preserve both mankind and the animals.
v 7
How precious is your covenant faithfulness, God!
Humanity takes refuge under the shadow of your wings.
v 8
They feast upon the abundance of your house;
you let them drink from the river of your delights.
v 9
For with you is the fountain of life;
in your light we will see light.
Extend your covenant faithfulness fully to those who know you,
your defense to the upright of heart.
Do not let the foot of the arrogant man come near to me.
Do not let the hand of the wicked drive me away.
Over there the evildoers have fallen;
they are knocked down and are not able to get up.
A psalm of David.
v 1
Do not be irritated because of evildoers;
do not be envious of those who act unrighteously.
v 2
For they will soon dry up as the grass
and wither as the green plants.
v 3
Trust in Yahweh and do what is good;
settle in the land and graze in faithfulness.
v 4
Then delight yourself in Yahweh,
and he will give you the desires of your heart.
v 5
Give your ways to Yahweh;
trust in him, and he will act on your behalf.
v 6
He will display your justice like the daylight
and your innocence like the day at noon.
v 7
Be still before Yahweh and wait patiently for him.
Do not be angry if someone succeeds in what he does,
or when he makes evil plots.
v 8
Do not be angry and frustrated.
Do not worry. This only makes trouble.
v 9
Evildoers will be cut off,
but those who wait for Yahweh will inherit the land.
In a little while the evil man will disappear;
you will look at his place, but he will be gone.
But the meek will inherit the land
and will delight in great prosperity.
The wicked man plots against the righteous
and he grinds his teeth in rage against him.
The Lord laughs at him,
for he sees that his day is coming.
The wicked have drawn out their swords and have bent their bows
to cast down the oppressed and needy,
to kill those who are upright.
Their swords will pierce their own hearts,
and their bows will be broken.
Better is the little that the righteous has
than the abundance of many wicked people.
For the arms of the wicked people will be broken,
but Yahweh supports the righteous people.
Yahweh watches over the blameless day by day,
and their heritage will be forever.
They will not be ashamed when times are bad.
When famine comes, they will have enough to eat.
But evil men will perish.
Yahweh’s enemies will be like the glory of the pastures;
they will be consumed and disappear in the smoke.
The wicked person borrows but does not repay,
but the righteous person is generous and gives.
Those who are blessed by God will inherit the land;
those who are cursed by him will be cut off.
It is by Yahweh that a man’s steps are established,
the man whose way is commendable in God’s sight.
Though he stumbles, he will not fall down,
for Yahweh is holding him with his hand.
I was young and now am old;
I have never seen the righteous person abandoned
or his children begging for bread.
All the day long he is gracious and lends,
and his children become a blessing.
Turn away from evil and do what is right;
then you will be safe forever.
For Yahweh loves justice
and does not abandon his faithful ones.
They are preserved forever,
but the descendants of the wicked will be cut off.
The righteous will inherit the land
and live there forever.
The mouth of the righteous person speaks wisdom
and increases justice.
The law of his God is in his heart;
his feet will not slip.
The wicked person watches the righteous person
and seeks to kill him.
Yahweh will not abandon him into the evil person’s hand
or condemn him when he is judged.
Wait for Yahweh and keep his way,
and he will raise you up to possess the land.
You will see when the wicked are cut off.
I have seen the wicked and terrifying person
spread out like a green tree in its native soil.
But when I passed by again, he was not there.
I looked for him, but he could not be found.
Observe the man of integrity, and mark the upright;
there is a good future for a man of peace.
Sinners will be totally destroyed;
the future for the wicked man is cut off.
Salvation of the righteous comes from Yahweh;
he protects them in the times of trouble.
Yahweh helps them and rescues them.
He rescues them from evil men and saves them
because they have taken refuge in him.
A psalm of David, to bring to remembrance.
v 1
Yahweh, do not rebuke me in your anger;
do not punish me in your wrath.
v 2
For your arrows pierce me,
and your hand presses me down.
v 3
My whole body is sick because of your anger;
there is no health in my bones because of my sin.
v 4
For my iniquities overwhelm me;
they are a burden too heavy for me.
v 5
My wounds are infected and smell
because of my foolish sins.
v 6
I am stooped over and humiliated every day;
I go about mourning all day long.
v 7
For within me, I am filled with burning;
there is no health in my flesh.
v 8
I am numb and utterly crushed;
I groan because of the anguish of my heart.
v 9
Lord, you understand my heart’s deepest yearnings,
and my groanings are not hidden from you.
My heart pounds, my strength fades,
and my eyesight dims.
My friends and companions shun me because of my condition;
my neighbors stand far off.
Those who seek my life lay snares for me.
They who seek my harm speak destructive words
and say deceitful words all day long.
But I, I am like a deaf man and hear nothing;
I am like a mute man who says nothing.
I am like a man who does not hear
and who has no reply.
Surely I wait for you, Yahweh;
you will answer, Lord my God.
I say this so that my enemies will not gloat over me.
If my foot slips, they will do terrible things to me.
For I am about to stumble,
and I am in constant pain.
I confess my guilt;
I am concerned about my sin.
But my enemies are numerous;
those who hate me wrongfully are many.
They repay me evil for good;
they hurl accusations at me although I have pursued what is good.
Do not abandon me, Yahweh;
my God, do not stay far away from me.
Come quickly to help me,
Lord, my salvation.
For the chief musician, for Jeduthun. A psalm of David.
v 1
I decided, “I will watch what I say
so that I do not sin with my tongue.
I will muzzle my mouth
while in the presence of an evil man.”
v 2
I kept silent; I kept back my words even from saying anything good,
and my pain grew worse.
v 3
My heart became hot;
when I thought about these things, it burned like a fire.
Then finally I spoke.
v 4
“Yahweh, make me know when will be the end of my life
and the extent of my days.
Show me how transient I am.
v 5
See, you have made my days only the width of my hand,
and my lifetime is like nothing before you.
Surely every man is a single breath.
Selah
v 6
Surely every man walks about like a shadow.
Surely everyone hurries about
to accumulate riches although they do not know who will receive them.
v 7
Now, Lord, for what am I waiting?
You are my only hope.
v 8
Rescue me from my sins;
do not make me the reproach of fools.
v 9
I am silent and cannot open my mouth,
because it is you who has done it.
Stop wounding me;
I am overwhelmed by the blow of your hand.
When you discipline people for sin,
you consume the things they desire like a moth;
surely all people are nothing but vapor.
Selah
Hear my prayer, Yahweh, and listen to me;
listen to my weeping!
Do not be deaf to me,
for I am like a foreigner with you, a refugee like all my ancestors were.
Turn your gaze from me so that I may smile again
before I die.”
For the chief musician. A psalm of David.
v 1
I waited patiently for Yahweh;
he listened to me and heard my cry.
v 2
He brought me up out of a horrible pit, out of the miry clay,
and he set my feet on a rock and made my steps secure.
v 3
He has put a new song in my mouth, praise to our God.
Many will see it and honor him
and will trust in Yahweh.
v 4
Blessed is the man who makes Yahweh his trust
and does not honor the proud or those who turn away from him to lies.
v 5
Many, Yahweh my God, are the wonderful deeds that you have done,
and your thoughts which are about us cannot be numbered;
if I declared and spoke of them,
they would be more than could be counted.
v 6
You have no delight in sacrifice or offering,
but you have opened my ears;
you have not required burnt offerings or sin offerings.
v 7
Then said I, “See, I have come;
it is written about me in the scroll of the document.
v 8
I delight to do your will, my God;
your laws are in my heart.”
v 9
I have proclaimed good news of your righteousness in the great assembly;
Yahweh, you know that my lips have not kept back from doing this.
I have not concealed your righteousness in my heart;
I have declared your faithfulness and your salvation;
I have not concealed your covenant faithfulness or your trustworthiness from the great assembly.
Do not keep back your acts of mercy from me, Yahweh;
let your covenant faithfulness and your trustworthiness always preserve me.
Troubles that cannot be numbered surround me;
my iniquities have caught up with me so that I am no longer able to see anything;
they are more than the hairs on my head,
and my heart has failed me.
Be pleased, Yahweh, to rescue me;
hurry to help me, Yahweh.
Let them be ashamed and completely disappointed
who pursue my life to take it away.
Let them be turned back and brought to dishonor,
those who delight in hurting me.
Let them be shocked because of their shame,
those who say to me, “Aha, aha!”
But may all those who seek you rejoice and be glad in you;
let everyone who loves your salvation say continually,
“May Yahweh be praised.”
I am poor and needy;
yet the Lord thinks about me.
You are my help and you come to my rescue;
do not delay, my God.
For the chief musician. A psalm of David.
v 1
Blessed is he who is concerned for the weak;
in the day of trouble, Yahweh will rescue him.
v 2
Yahweh will preserve him and keep him alive,
and he will be blessed on the earth;
Yahweh will not turn him over to the will of his enemies.
v 3
Yahweh will support him on the bed of suffering;
you will make his bed of sickness into a bed of healing.
v 4
I said, “Yahweh, have mercy on me!
Heal me, for I have sinned against you.”
v 5
My enemies speak evil against me, saying,
‘When will he die and his name perish?’
v 6
If my enemy comes to see me, he says worthless things;
his heart gathers up my disaster for itself;
when he goes away from me, he tells others about it.
v 7
All who hate me whisper together against me;
against me they hope for my hurt.
v 8
They say, “An evil disease holds on tightly to him;
now that he is lying down, he will rise up no more.”
v 9
Indeed, even my own close friend, in whom I trusted,
who ate my bread,
has lifted up his heel against me.
But you, Yahweh, have mercy on me and raise me up
so that I may pay them back.
By this I know that you delight in me,
for my enemy does not triumph over me.
As for me, you support me in my integrity
and will keep me before your face forever.
May Yahweh, the God of Israel be praised
from everlasting to everlasting.
Amen and Amen.
>> Heading
For the chief musician. A maschil of the sons of Korah.
v 1
As the deer pants after streams of water,
so I thirst for you, God.
v 2
I thirst for God, for the living God,
when will I come and appear before God?
v 3
My tears have been my food day and night,
while my enemies are always saying to me, “Where is your God?”
v 4
These things I call to mind as I pour out my soul:
how I went with the throng and led them to the house of God
with the voice of joy and praise, a multitude celebrating a festival.
v 5
Why are you bowed down, my soul?
Why are you upset within me?
Hope in God, for again I will praise him who is my salvation.
v 6
My God, my soul is bowed down within me,
therefore I call you to mind from the land of the Jordan,
from the three peaks of Mount Hermon, and from the hill of Mizar.
v 7
Deep calls to deep at the noise of your waterfalls;
all your waves and your billows have gone over me.
v 8
Yet Yahweh will command his covenant faithfulness in the daytime;
in the night his song will be with me,
a prayer to the God of my life.
v 9
I will say to God, my rock, “Why have you forgotten me?
Why do I go mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?”
As with a sword in my bones, my adversaries rebuke me,
while they always say to me, “Where is your God?”
Why are you bowed down, my soul?
Why are you upset within me?
Hope in God, for again I will praise him who is my salvation and my God.
v 1
Bring me justice, God, and plead my cause against a nation that is not faithful.
v 2
For you are the God of my strength. Why have you rejected me?
Why do I go about in mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?
v 3
Oh, send out your light and your truth, let them lead me.
Let them bring me to your holy hill
and to your dwelling.
v 4
Then I will go to the altar of God,
to God my exceeding joy.
I will praise you with the harp, God, my God.
v 5
Why are you bowed down, my soul?
Why are you upset within me?
Hope in God, for again I will praise him who is my salvation and my God.
For the chief musician. A psalm of the sons of Korah. A maschil.
v 1
We have heard with our ears, God,
our fathers have told us
what work you did in their days,
in the days of old.
v 2
You drove out the nations with your hand,
but you planted our people;
you afflicted the peoples,
but you spread our people out in the land.
v 3
For they did not obtain the land for their possession by their own sword,
neither did their own arm save them;
but your right hand, your arm, and the light of your face,
because you were favorable to them.
v 4
God, You are my King;
command victory for Jacob.
v 5
Through you we will push down our adversaries;
through your name we will tread them under, those who rise up against us.
v 6
For I will not trust in my bow,
neither will my sword save me.
v 7
But you have saved us from our adversaries,
and have put to shame those who hate us.
v 8
In God we have made our boast all the day long,
and we will give thanks to your name forever.
Selah
v 9
But now you have thrown us off and brought us dishonor,
and you do not go out with our armies.
You make us turn back from the adversary;
and those who hate us take spoil for themselves.
You have made us like sheep to be slaughtered
and have scattered us among the nations.
You sell your people for nothing;
you have not increased your wealth by doing so.
You make us a rebuke to our neighbors,
scoffed and mocked by those around us.
You make us an insult among the nations,
a shaking of the head among the peoples.
All the day long my dishonor is before me,
and the shame of my face has covered me
because of the voice of him who rebukes and insults,
because of the enemy and the avenger.
All this has come on us; yet we have not forgotten you
or dealt falsely with your covenant.
Our heart has not turned back;
our steps have not gone from your way.
Yet you have severely broken us in the place of jackals
and covered us with the shadow of death.
If we have forgotten the name of our God
or spread out our hands to a strange god,
would not God search this out?
For he knows the secrets of the heart.
Indeed, for your sake we are being killed all day long;
we are considered to be sheep for the slaughter.
Awake, why do you sleep, Lord?
Arise, do not throw us off permanently.
Why do you hide your face
and forget our affliction and our oppression?
For we have sunk down into the dust;
our bodies cling to the earth.
Rise up for our help
and redeem us for the sake of your covenant faithfulness.
For the chief musician; set to Shoshannim. A psalm of the sons of Korah. A maschil. A song of loves.
v 1
My heart overflows on a good subject;
I will read aloud the words I have composed about the king;
my tongue is the pen of a ready writer.
v 2
You are fairer than the children of mankind;
grace is poured onto your lips;
therefore we know that God has blessed you forever.
v 3
Put your sword on your side, mighty one,
in your glory and your majesty.
v 4
In your majesty ride on triumphantly
because of trustworthiness, meekness, and righteousness;
your right hand will teach you fearful things.
v 5
Your arrows are sharp;
the peoples fall under you;
your arrows are in the hearts of the king’s enemies.
v 6
Your throne, God, is forever and ever;
a scepter of justice is the scepter of your kingdom.
v 7
You have loved righteousness and hated wickedness;
therefore God, your God, has anointed you
with the oil of gladness more than your companions.
v 8
All your garments smell of myrrh, aloes, and cassia;
out of ivory palaces stringed instruments have made you glad.
v 9
Kings’ daughters are among your honorable women;
at your right hand stands the queen clothed in gold of Ophir.
Listen, daughter, consider and incline your ear;
forget your own people and your father’s house.
In this way the king will desire your beauty;
he is your master; revere him.
The daughter of Tyre will be there with a gift;
the rich among the people will beg for your favor.
The royal daughter in the palace is all glorious;
her clothing is worked with gold.
She will be led to the king in embroidered dress;
the virgins, her companions who follow her,
will be brought to you.
They will be led by gladness and rejoicing;
they will enter into the king’s palace.
In the place of your fathers will be your children,
whom you will make princes in all the earth.
I will make your name to be remembered in all generations;
therefore the peoples will give you thanks forever and ever.
For the chief musician. A psalm of the sons of Korah; set to Alamoth. A song.
v 1
God is our refuge and strength,
a very present help in trouble.
v 2
Therefore we will not fear, though the earth should change,
though the mountains should be shaken into the heart of the seas,
v 3
though its waters roar and rage, and
though the mountains tremble with their swelling.
Selah
v 4
There is a river whose streams make the city of God happy,
the holy place where the Most High dwells.
v 5
God is in the middle of her; she will not be moved;
God will help her, and he will do so at the dawn of morning.
v 6
The nations raged and the kingdoms were shaken;
he lifted up his voice, and the earth melted.
v 7
Yahweh of hosts is with us;
the God of Jacob is our refuge.
Selah
v 8
Come, behold the deeds of Yahweh,
the destruction he has caused on earth.
v 9
He makes wars cease to the ends of the earth;
he breaks the bow and cuts the spear into pieces;
he burns up the shields.
Be quiet and know that I am God;
I will be exalted among the nations; I will be exalted on the earth.
Yahweh of hosts is with us;
the God of Jacob is our refuge.
Selah
For the chief musician. A psalm of the sons of Korah.
v 1
Clap your hands, all you peoples;
shout to God with the sound of triumph.
v 2
For Yahweh Most High is terrifying;
he is a great King over all the earth.
v 3
He subdues peoples under us
and nations under our feet.
v 4
He chooses our inheritance for us,
the glory of Jacob whom he loved.
Selah
v 5
God has gone up with a shout,
Yahweh with the sound of a trumpet.
v 6
Sing praises to God, sing praises;
sing praises to our King, sing praises.
v 7
For God is the King over all the earth;
sing praises with understanding.
v 8
God reigns over the nations;
God sits on his holy throne.
v 9
The princes of the peoples have gathered together
to the people of the God of Abraham;
for the shields of the earth belong to God;
he is greatly exalted.
A song; a psalm of the sons of Korah.
v 1
Great is Yahweh and greatly to be praised,
in the city of our God on his holy mountain.
v 2
Beautiful in elevation, the joy of the whole earth,
is Mount Zion, on the sides of the north,
the city of the great King.
v 3
God has made himself known in her palaces as a refuge.
v 4
For, see, the kings assembled themselves;
they passed by together.
v 5
They saw it, then they were amazed;
they were dismayed, and they hurried away.
v 6
Trembling took hold of them there,
pain as when a woman is in labor.
v 7
With the east wind
you break the ships of Tarshish.
v 8
As we have heard, so have we seen
in the city of Yahweh of hosts, in the city of our God;
God will establish it forever.
Selah
v 9
We have thought about your covenant faithfulness, God,
in the middle of your temple.
As your name is, God,
so is your praise to the ends of the earth;
your right hand is full of righteousness.
Let Mount Zion be glad,
let the daughters of Judah rejoice
because of your righteous decrees.
Walk around Mount Zion, go round about her;
count her towers,
notice well her walls,
and look at her palaces
so that you may tell it to the next generation.
For this God is our God forever and ever;
he will be our guide to death.
For the chief musician. A psalm of the sons of Korah.
v 1
Hear this, all you peoples;
give ear, all you inhabitants of the world,
v 2
both low and high,
rich and poor together.
v 3
My mouth will speak wisdom
and the meditation of my heart will be of understanding.
v 4
I will incline my ear to a parable;
I will begin my parable with the harp.
v 5
Why should I fear the days of evil,
when iniquity surrounds me at my heels?
v 6
Why should I fear those who trust in their wealth
and boast about the amount of their riches?
v 7
It is certain that no one can redeem his brother
or give God a ransom for him,
v 8
For the redemption of one’s life is costly,
and no one can pay what we owe.
v 9
No one can live forever
so that his body should not decay.
For he will see decay. Wise men die;
the fool and the brute alike perish
and leave their wealth to others.
Their inner thought is that their families will continue forever,
and the places where they live, to all generations;
they call their lands after their own names.
But man, having wealth, does not remain alive;
he is like the beasts that perish.
This, their way, is their folly;
yet after them, men approve of their sayings.
Selah
Like sheep they are appointed for Sheol,
and death will be their shepherd.
The upright will rule over them in the morning,
and their bodies will be consumed in Sheol,
with no place for them to live.
But God will redeem my life from the power of Sheol;
he will receive me.
Selah
Do not be afraid when one becomes rich,
and the glory of his house increases.
For when he dies he will take nothing away;
his glory will not go down after him.
He blessed his soul while he lived—
and men praise you when you live for yourself—
he will go to the generation of his fathers
and they will never see the light again.
One who has wealth but no understanding
is like the beasts, which perish.
A psalm of Asaph.
v 1
The Mighty One, God, Yahweh, has spoken
and called the earth from the rising of the sun to its setting.
v 2
Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty,
God has shone.
v 3
Our God comes and does not stay silent;
a fire devours before him,
and it is very stormy around him.
v 4
He calls to the heavens above
and to the earth so that he may judge his people:
v 5
“Gather my faithful ones together to me,
those who have made a covenant with me by sacrifice.”
v 6
The heavens will declare his righteousness,
for God himself is judge.
Selah
v 7
“Hear, my people, and I will speak;
I am God, your God.
v 8
I will not reprove you for your sacrifices;
your burnt offerings are always before me.
v 9
I will take no bull out of your house,
or male goats out of your folds.
For every beast of the forest is mine,
and the cattle on a thousand hills.
I know all the birds of the mountains,
and the wild beasts of the field are mine.
If I were hungry, I would not tell you;
for the world is mine, and everything in it.
Will I eat the flesh of bulls
or drink the blood of goats?
Offer to God the sacrifice of thanksgiving,
and pay your vows to the Most High.
Call on me in the day of trouble;
I will rescue you, and you will glorify me.”
But to the wicked God says,
“What have you to do with declaring my statutes,
that you have taken my covenant in your mouth,
since you hate instruction
and throw my words away?
When you see a thief, you agree with him;
you participate with those who commit adultery.
You give your mouth to evil,
and your tongue expresses deceit.
You sit and speak against your brother;
you slander your own mother’s son.
You have done these things, but I have kept silent,
so you thought that I was someone just like yourself.
But I will reprove you and bring up, right before your eyes, all the things you have done.
Give this careful consideration, you who forget God,
otherwise I will tear you to pieces,
and there will be no one to come to help you!
The one who offers a sacrifice of thanksgiving praises me,
and to anyone who plans his path in the right way
I will show God’s salvation.”
For the chief musician. A psalm of David; when Nathan the prophet came to him after he had gone in to Bathsheba.
v 1
Have mercy on me, God, because of your covenant faithfulness;
for the sake of the multitude of your merciful actions, blot out my transgressions.
v 2
Wash me thoroughly from my iniquity
and cleanse me from my sin.
v 3
For I know my transgressions,
and my sin is always before me.
v 4
Against you, you only, I have sinned
and done what is evil in your sight;
you are right when you speak;
you are correct when you judge.
v 5
See, I was born in iniquity;
as soon as my mother conceived me, I was in sin.
v 6
See, you desire trustworthiness in my inner self;
and you teach me wisdom in the secret place within.
v 7
Purify me with hyssop, and I will be clean;
wash me, and I will be whiter than snow.
v 8
Make me hear joy and gladness
so that the bones that you have broken may rejoice.
v 9
Hide your face from my sins
and blot out all my iniquities.
Create in me a clean heart, God,
and renew a right spirit within me.
Do not drive me away from your presence,
and do not take your holy Spirit from me.
Restore to me the joy of your salvation,
and sustain me with a willing spirit.
Then will I teach transgressors your ways,
and sinners will be converted to you.
Forgive me for shedding blood, God of my salvation,
and I will shout for the joy of your righteousness.
Lord, open my lips,
and my mouth will express your praise.
For you do not delight in sacrifice, or I would give it;
you have no pleasure in burnt offerings.
The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit.
You, God, will not despise a broken and a contrite heart.
Do good in your good pleasure to Zion;
rebuild the walls of Jerusalem.
Then will you delight in the sacrifices of righteousness,
in burnt offerings and whole burnt offerings;
then our people will offer bulls on your altar.
For the chief musician. A maschil of David; when Doeg the Edomite came and told Saul, and said to him, “David has come to the house of Ahimelech.”
v 1
Why are you proud of making trouble, you mighty man?
The covenant faithfulness of God comes every day.
v 2
Your tongue plans destruction
like a sharp razor, working deceitfully.
v 3
You love evil more than good
and lying rather than speaking righteousness.
Selah
v 4
You love all words that devour others,
you deceitful tongue.
v 5
God will likewise destroy you forever;
he will take you up and pluck you out of your tent
and root you out of the land of the living.
Selah
v 6
The righteous will also see it and fear;
they will laugh at him and say,
v 7
“See, this is a man who did not make God his refuge,
but he trusted in the abundance of his wealth,
and he was strong when he destroyed others.”
v 8
But as for me, I am like a green olive tree in God’s house;
I will trust in the covenant faithfulness of God forever and ever.
v 9
I will give you thanks forever for what you have done.
I will wait for your name, because it is good,
in the presence of your faithful ones.
For the chief musician; set to Mahalath. A maschil of David.
v 1
A fool says in his heart, “There is no God.”
They are corrupt and have done abominable iniquity;
there is no one who does good.
v 2
God looks down from heaven on the children of mankind
to see if there are any who understand,
who seek after him.
v 3
They have all turned away. Together they have become corrupt.
There is not one who does good, not even one.
v 4
Do those who commit iniquity have no understanding—
those who devour my people as if they were eating bread
and they do not call on God?
v 5
They were in great fear, although no reason to fear was there;
for God will scatter the bones of whoever will camp against you;
such people will be put to shame because God has rejected them.
v 6
Oh, that the salvation of Israel would come from Zion!
When God brings back his people from the captivity,
then Jacob will rejoice and Israel will be glad!
For the chief musician; on stringed instruments. A maschil of David; when the Ziphites came and said to Saul, “Does David not hide himself with us?”
v 1
Save me, God, by your name,
and judge me in your might.
v 2
Hear my prayer, God;
give ear to the words of my mouth.
v 3
For strangers have risen up against me,
and pitiless men have sought after my life;
they have not set God before them.
Selah
v 4
See, God is my helper;
the Lord is the one who upholds me.
v 5
He will repay my enemies with evil;
in your faithfulness, destroy them!
v 6
I will sacrifice to you with a freewill offering;
I will give thanks to your name, Yahweh, for it is good.
v 7
For he has rescued me from every trouble;
my eye has looked in triumph on my enemies.
For the chief musician; on stringed instruments. A maschil of David.
v 1
Give ear to my prayer, God;
and do not hide yourself from my plea.
v 2
Pay attention to me and answer me;
I have no rest in my troubles
v 3
because of the voice of my enemies,
because of the oppression of the wicked;
for they bring trouble on me
and persecute me in anger.
v 4
My heart trembles within me,
and the terrors of death have fallen on me.
v 5
Fearfulness and trembling have come on me,
and horror has overwhelmed me.
v 6
