you are clothed with splendor and majesty.
v 2
You cover yourself with light as with a garment;
you spread out the heavens like a tent curtain.
v 3
You lay the beams of your chambers on the clouds;
you make the clouds your chariot;
you walk on the wings of the wind.
v 4
He makes the winds his messengers,
flames of fire his servants.
v 5
He laid the foundations of the earth,
and it will never be moved.
v 6
You covered the earth with water like a garment;
the water covered the mountains.
v 7
Your rebuke made the waters recede;
at the sound of your thunderous voice they fled.
v 8
The mountains rose, and the valleys spread out
into the places that you had appointed for them.
v 9
You have set a boundary for them that they will not cross;
they will not cover the earth again.
He made springs flow into the valleys;
the streams flow between the mountains.
They supply water for all the animals of the field;
the wild donkeys quench their thirst.
By the riverbanks the birds build their nests;
they sing among the branches.
He waters the mountains from his water chambers in the sky.
The earth is filled with the fruit of his labor.
He makes the grass grow for the cattle
and plants for man to cultivate
so that man may produce food from the earth.
He makes wine to make man happy,
oil to make his face shine,
and food to sustain his life.
The trees of Yahweh get plenty of rain;
the cedars of Lebanon which he planted.
There the birds make their nests.
The stork makes the cypress tree her home.
The wild goats live on the high mountains;
the mountain heights are a refuge for the hyraxes.
He appointed the moon to mark the seasons;
the sun knows its time for setting.
You make the darkness of the night
when all the beasts of the forest come out.
The young lions roar for their prey
and seek their food from God.
When the sun rises, they retreat
and sleep in their dens.
Meanwhile, people go out to their work
and labor away until the evening.
Yahweh, how many and varied are your works!
With wisdom you made them all;
the earth overflows with your works.
Over there is the sea, deep and wide,
teeming with innumerable creatures,
both small and great.
The ships travel there,
and Leviathan is also there, which you formed to play in the sea.
All these look to you to give them
their food on time.
When you give to them, they gather;
when you open your hand, they are satisfied.
When you hide your face, they are troubled;
if you take away their breath, they die
and return to dust.
When you send out your Spirit, they are created,
and you renew the countryside.
May the glory of Yahweh last forever;
may Yahweh enjoy his creation.
He looks down on the earth, and it shakes;
he touches the mountains, and they smoke.
I will sing to Yahweh all my life;
I will sing praise to my God as long as I live.
May my thoughts be sweet to him;
I will rejoice in Yahweh.
May sinners vanish from the earth,
and let the wicked be no more.
I give praise to Yahweh with all my life.
Praise Yahweh.
v 1
Give thanks to Yahweh, call on his name;
make known his deeds among the nations.
v 2
Sing to him, sing praises to him;
speak of all his marvelous deeds.
v 3
Boast in his holy name;
let the heart of those who seek Yahweh rejoice.
v 4
Seek Yahweh and his strength;
seek his presence continually.
v 5
Recall the marvelous things he has done,
his miracles and the decrees from his mouth,
v 6
you descendants of Abraham his servant,
you people of Jacob, his chosen ones.
v 7
He is Yahweh, our God.
His decrees are on all the earth.
v 8
He keeps in mind his covenant forever,
the word that he commanded for a thousand generations.
v 9
He calls to mind the covenant that he made with Abraham
and his oath to Isaac.
This is what he confirmed to Jacob as a statute
and to Israel as an everlasting covenant.
He said, “I will give you the land of Canaan
as your share of your inheritance.”
He said this when they were only few in number,
so very few, and were strangers in the land.
They went from nation to nation
and from one kingdom to another.
He did not allow anyone to oppress them;
he rebuked kings for their sakes.
He said, “Do not touch my anointed ones,
and do not harm my prophets.”
He called for a famine on the land;
he cut off the whole supply of bread.
He sent a man ahead of them;
Joseph was sold as a servant.
His feet were bound by shackles;
on his neck was put an iron collar,
until what he had said came to pass.
The word of Yahweh tested him.
The king sent servants to release him;
the ruler of the people set him free.
He put him in charge of his house
as ruler of all his possessions
to instruct his princes as he wished
and to teach his elders wisdom.
Then Israel came into Egypt,
and Jacob lived for a time in the land of Ham.
Yahweh made his people fruitful,
and made them stronger than their enemies.
He caused their enemies to hate his people,
to mistreat his servants.
He sent Moses, his servant,
and Aaron, whom he had chosen.
They performed his signs among the Egyptians,
his wonders in the land of Ham.
He sent darkness and made that land dark,
but its people did not obey his commands.
He turned their water into blood
and killed their fish.
Their land swarmed with frogs,
even in the rooms of their rulers.
He spoke, and swarms of flies and gnats came
throughout their country.
He turned their rain into hail,
with fire flaming on their land.
He destroyed their vines and fig trees;
he broke the trees of their country.
He spoke, and the locusts came,
so many locusts.
The locusts ate up all of the vegetation in their land;
They ate up all the crops of the ground.
He killed every firstborn in their land,
the firstfruits of all their strength.
He brought the Israelites out with silver and gold;
none of his tribes stumbled on the way.
Egypt was glad when they went away,
for the Egyptians were afraid of them.
He spread a cloud for a covering
and made a fire to light up the night.
The Israelites asked for food, and he brought quail
and satisfied them with bread from heaven.
He split the rock, and waters gushed from it;
they flowed in the wilderness like a river.
For he called to mind his holy promise
that he made to Abraham his servant.
He led his people out with joy,
his chosen with shouts of triumph.
He gave them the lands of the nations;
they took possession of the wealth of the peoples
so that they might keep his statutes
and obey his laws.
Praise Yahweh.
v 1
Praise Yahweh.
Give thanks to Yahweh, for he is good,
for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.
v 2
Who can recount the mighty acts of Yahweh
or proclaim in full all his praiseworthy deeds?
v 3
Blessed are those who do what is right,
and whose deeds are always just.
v 4
Call me to mind, Yahweh, when you show favor to your people;
help me when you save them.
v 5
Then I will see the prosperity of your chosen,
rejoice in the gladness of your nation,
and glory with your inheritance.
v 6
We have sinned like our ancestors;
we have done wrong, and we have done evil.
v 7
Our fathers did not appreciate your marvelous deeds in Egypt;
they ignored your many acts of covenant faithfulness;
they were rebellious at the sea, the Sea of Reeds.
v 8
Nevertheless, he saved them for his name’s sake
so that he might reveal his power.
v 9
He rebuked the Sea of Reeds, and it dried up.
Then he led them through the depths, as through a wilderness.
He saved them from the hand of those who hated them,
and he rescued them from the hand of the enemy.
But the waters covered their adversaries;
not one of them survived.
Then they believed his words,
and they sang his praise.
But they quickly forgot what he had done;
they did not wait for his instructions.
They had insatiable cravings in the wilderness,
and they challenged God in the desert.
So he gave them what they requested,
but he sent a horrible disease upon them.
In the camp they became jealous of Moses
and Aaron, the holy priest of Yahweh.
The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan
and covered the followers of Abiram.
Fire broke out among them;
the fire consumed the wicked.
They made a calf at Horeb
and worshiped a cast metal figure.
They traded the glory of God
for the image of a bull that eats grass.
They forgot God their Savior,
who had done great deeds in Egypt.
He had done wonderful things in the land of Ham
and mighty acts at the Sea of Reeds.
So he said he would destroy them—
had not Moses, his chosen one, stood in the breach before him,
to turn away his anger from destroying them.
Then they despised the fruitful land;
they did not believe his promise,
but grumbled in their tents,
and did not obey Yahweh.
Therefore he raised his hand and swore to them
that he would let them die in the desert,
scatter their descendants among the nations,
and scatter them in foreign lands.
They worshiped the Baal of Peor
and ate the sacrifices offered to the dead.
They provoked him to anger with their actions,
and a plague broke out among them.
Then Phinehas rose to intervene,
and the plague subsided.
It was counted to him as a righteous deed
to all generations forever.
They also angered Yahweh at the waters of Meribah,
and Moses suffered because of them.
They made Moses bitter,
and he spoke rashly.
They did not destroy the nations
as Yahweh had commanded them,
but they mingled with the nations
and learned their ways
and worshiped their idols,
which became a snare to them.
They sacrificed their sons and their daughters to demons.
They shed innocent blood,
the blood of their sons and of their daughters,
whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan,
desecrating the land with blood.
They were defiled by their deeds;
in their actions they were like prostitutes.
So Yahweh was angry with his people,
and he despised his own people.
He gave them into the hand of the nations,
and those who hated them ruled over them.
Their enemies oppressed them,
and they were brought into subjection to their authority.
Many times he came to help them,
but they kept rebelling
and were brought low by their own sin.
Nevertheless, he paid attention to their distress
when he heard their cry for help.
He called to mind his covenant with them
and relented because of his steadfast love.
He caused all their conquerers
to have pity on them.
Save us, Yahweh, our God.
Gather us from among the nations
so that we may give thanks to your holy name
and glory in your praises.
May Yahweh, the God of Israel, be praised
from everlasting to everlasting.
All the people said, “Amen.”
Praise Yahweh.
>> Heading
v 1
Give thanks to Yahweh, for he is good,
and his covenant faithfulness endures forever.
v 2
Let the redeemed of Yahweh speak out,
those he has rescued from the hand of the enemy.
v 3
He has gathered them out of foreign lands,
from the east and from the west,
from the north and from the south.
v 4
They wandered in the wilderness on a desert road
and found no city in which to live.
v 5
Because they were hungry and thirsty,
they fainted from exhaustion.
v 6
Then they called out to Yahweh in their trouble,
and he rescued them out of their distress.
v 7
He led them by a direct path
so that they would go to a city to live in.
v 8
Oh that people would praise Yahweh for his covenant faithfulness
and for the amazing things he has done for humanity!
v 9
For he satisfies the longings of those who are thirsty,
and the desires of those who are hungry he fills up with good things.
Some sat in darkness and in gloom,
prisoners in affliction and chains.
This was because they had rebelled against God’s word
and rejected the instruction of the Most High.
He humbled their hearts through hardship;
they stumbled and there was no one to help them up.
Then they called out to Yahweh in their trouble,
and he brought them out of their distress.
He brought them out of darkness and gloom
and broke their bonds.
Oh that people would praise Yahweh for his covenant faithfulness
and for the amazing things he has done for humanity!
For he has broken the gates of bronze
and cut through the bars of iron.
They were foolish in their rebellious ways
and afflicted because of their sins.
They lost their desire to eat any food,
and they came close to the gates of death.
Then they called out to Yahweh in their trouble,
and he brought them out of their distress.
He sent his word and healed them,
and he rescued them from their destruction.
Oh that people would praise Yahweh for his covenant faithfulness
and for the amazing things he has done for humanity!
Let them offer the sacrifices of thanksgiving
and proclaim his deeds in singing.
Some travel on the sea in ships
and do business overseas.
These saw the deeds of Yahweh
and his wonders on the seas.
For he commanded and aroused the windstorm
that stirs up the seas.
They reached up to the sky; they went down to the depths.
Their lives melted away in distress.
They swayed and staggered like drunkards
and were at their wits’ end.
Then they called out to Yahweh in their trouble,
and he brought them out of their distress.
He calmed the storm,
and the waves were stilled.
Then they rejoiced because the sea was calm,
and he brought them to their desired harbor.
Oh that people would praise Yahweh for his covenant faithfulness
and for the amazing things he has done for humanity!
Let them exalt him in the assembly of the people
and praise him in the council of the elders.
He turns rivers into a wilderness,
springs of water into dry land,
and a fruitful land into a barren place
because of the wickedness of its people.
He turns the wilderness into a pool of water
and dry land into springs of water.
He settles the hungry there,
and they build a city to live in.
They build a city to plant fields in, to plant vineyards,
and to bring in an abundant harvest.
He blesses them so they are very numerous.
He does not let their cattle decrease in number.
They were diminished and brought low
by painful distress and suffering.
He pours contempt on the leaders
and causes them to wander in the wilderness, where there are no roads.
But he protects the needy from affliction
and cares for his families like a flock.
The upright will see this and rejoice,
and all wickedness shuts its mouth.
Whoever is wise should take note of these things
and meditate on Yahweh’s acts of covenant faithfulness.
A song, a psalm of David.
v 1
My heart is fixed, God;
I will sing, yes, I will sing praises also with my honored heart.
v 2
Wake up, lute and harp;
I will wake up the dawn.
v 3
I will give thanks to you, Yahweh, among the peoples;
I will sing praises to you among the nations.
v 4
For your covenant faithfulness is great above the heavens;
and your trustworthiness reaches to the skies.
v 5
Be exalted, God, above the heavens,
and may your glory be exalted over all the earth.
v 6
So that those you love may be rescued,
rescue us with your right hand and answer me.
v 7
God has spoken in his holiness; “I will rejoice;
I will divide Shechem and apportion out the Valley of Succoth.
v 8
Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine;
Ephraim also is my helmet;
Judah is my scepter.
v 9
Moab is my washbasin;
over Edom I will throw my shoe;
I will shout in triumph because of Philistia.
Who will bring me into the strong city?
Who will lead me to Edom?”
God, have you not rejected us?
You do not go into battle with our army.
Give us help against the enemy,
for man’s help is futile.
We will triumph with God’s help;
he will trample down our enemies.
For the chief musician. A psalm of David.
v 1
God whom I praise, do not be silent,
v 2
For the wicked and deceitful attack me;
they speak lies against me.
v 3
They surround me and say hateful things,
and they attack me without cause.
v 4
In return for my love they accuse me,
but I pray for them.
v 5
They repay me evil for good,
and they hate my love.
v 6
Appoint a wicked man over such an enemy as these people;
appoint an accuser to stand at his right hand.
v 7
When he is judged, may he be found guilty;
may his prayer be considered sinful.
v 8
May his days be few;
may another take his office.
v 9
May his children be fatherless,
and may his wife be a widow.
May his children wander about and beg,
asking for handouts as they leave their ruined home.
May the creditor take all he owns;
may strangers plunder what he earns.
May no one extend any kindness to him;
may no one have pity on his fatherless children.
May his children be cut off;
may their name be blotted out in the next generation.
May his ancestors’ sins be mentioned to Yahweh;
and may the sin of his mother not be forgotten.
May their guilt always be before Yahweh;
may Yahweh cut off their memory from the earth.
May Yahweh do this because this man never bothered to show any covenant faithfulness,
but instead harassed the oppressed, the needy,
and the disheartened to death.
He loved cursing; may it come back upon him.
He hated blessing; may no blessing come to him.
He clothed himself with cursing as his garment,
and his curse came into his inner being like water,
like oil into his bones.
May his curses be to him like the clothes he wears to cover himself,
like the belt he always wears.
May this be the reward of my accusers from Yahweh,
of those who say evil things about me.
Yahweh my Lord, deal kindly with me for your name’s sake.
Because your covenant faithfulness is good, save me.
For I am oppressed and needy,
and my heart is wounded within me.
I am fading away like the shadow of the evening;
I am shaken off like a locust.
My knees are weak from fasting;
I am turning to skin and bones.
I am disdained by my accusers;
when they see me, they shake their heads.
Help me, Yahweh my God;
save me by your covenant faithfulness.
May they know that this is your doing,
that you, Yahweh, have done this.
Though they curse me, please bless me;
when they attack, may they be put to shame,
but may your servant rejoice.
May my adversaries be clothed with shame;
may they wear their shame like a robe.
With my mouth I give great thanks to Yahweh;
I will praise him in the midst of a crowd.
For he will stand at the right hand of the one who is needy,
to save him from those who judge him.
A psalm of David.
v 1
Yahweh says to my master, “Sit at my right hand
until I make your enemies your footstool.”
v 2
Yahweh will hold out the scepter of your strength from Zion;
rule among your enemies.
v 3
Your people will follow you in holy garments
of their own free will on the day of your power;
from the womb of the dawn your youth will be to you like the dew.
v 4
Yahweh has sworn, and will not change:
“You are a priest forever,
after the manner of Melchizedek.”
v 5
The Lord is at your right hand.
He will kill kings on the day of his anger.
v 6
He will judge the nations;
he will fill the battlegrounds with dead bodies;
he will kill the leaders in many countries.
v 7
He will drink of the brook along the road,
and then he will lift his head up high after victory.
v 1
Praise Yahweh.
I will give thanks to Yahweh with my whole heart
in the assembly of the upright, in their gathering.
v 2
The works of Yahweh are great,
eagerly awaited by all those who desire them.
v 3
His work is majestic and glorious,
and his righteousness endures forever.
v 4
He does wonderful things that will be remembered;
Yahweh is gracious and merciful.
v 5
He gives food to his faithful followers.
He will always call to mind his covenant.
v 6
He showed his powerful works to his people
in giving them the inheritance of the nations.
v 7
The works of his hands are trustworthy and just;
all his instructions are reliable.
v 8
They are established forever,
to be observed faithfully and properly.
v 9
He gave victory to his people;
he ordained his covenant forever;
holy and awesome is his name.
To honor Yahweh is the beginning of wisdom;
those who carry out his instructions have good understanding.
His praise endures forever.
v 1
Praise Yahweh.
Blessed is the man who fears Yahweh,
who greatly delights in his commandments.
v 2
His descendants will be powerful on earth;
the descendants of the godly man will be blessed.
v 3
Wealth and riches are in his house;
his righteousness will endure forever.
v 4
Light shines in the darkness for the godly person;
he is gracious, merciful, and just.
v 5
It goes well for the man who deals graciously and lends money,
who conducts his affairs with honesty.
v 6
For he will never be moved;
the righteous person will be remembered forever.
v 7
He does not fear bad news;
he is confident, trusting in Yahweh.
v 8
His heart is tranquil, without fear,
until he looks in triumph over his adversaries.
v 9
He generously gives to the poor;
his righteousness endures forever;
he will be exalted with honor.
The wicked person will see this and be angry;
he will grind his teeth in rage and he will melt away;
the desire of the wicked people will perish.
v 1
Praise Yahweh.
Praise him, you servants of Yahweh;
praise the name of Yahweh.
v 2
Blessed be the name of Yahweh,
both now and forevermore.
v 3
From the rising of the sun to its setting,
Yahweh’s name should be praised.
v 4
Yahweh is exalted above all nations,
and his glory reaches above the skies.
v 5
Who is like Yahweh our God,
who has his seat on high,
v 6
who looks down
at the sky and at the earth?
v 7
He raises up the poor out of the dirt
and lifts up the needy from the ash heap,
v 8
so that he may seat him with princes,
with the princes of his people.
v 9
He gives a home to the barren woman of the house,
he makes her a joyful mother of children.
Praise Yahweh!
v 1
When Israel left Egypt,
the house of Jacob from a people who spoke a foreign language,
v 2
Judah became his holy place,
Israel his kingdom.
v 3
The sea looked and fled;
the Jordan turned back.
v 4
The mountains skipped like rams,
the hills skipped like lambs.
v 5
Why did you flee, sea?
Jordan, why did you turn back?
v 6
Mountains, why did you skip like rams?
You little hills, why did you skip like lambs?
v 7
Tremble, earth, before the Lord,
at the presence of the God of Jacob.
v 8
He turned the rock into a pool of water,
the hard rock into a spring of water.
v 1
Not to us, Yahweh, not to us,
but to your name bring honor,
for your covenant faithfulness and for your trustworthiness.
v 2
Why should the nations say,
“Where is their God?”
v 3
Our God is in heaven;
he does whatever he pleases.
v 4
The nations’ idols are silver and gold,
the work of men’s hands.
v 5
Those idols have mouths, but they do not speak;
they have eyes, but they do not see;
v 6
they have ears, but they do not hear;
they have noses, but they do not smell.
v 7
Those idols have hands, but do not feel;
they have feet, but they cannot walk;
nor do they speak from their mouths.
v 8
Those who make them are like them,
as is everyone who trusts in them.
v 9
Israel, trust in Yahweh;
he is your help and shield.
House of Aaron, trust in Yahweh;
he is your help and shield.
You who honor Yahweh, trust in him;
he is your help and shield.
Yahweh takes notice of us and will bless us;
he will bless the family of Israel;
he will bless the family of Aaron.
He will bless those who honor him,
both young and old.
May Yahweh increase your numbers more and more,
yours and your descendants’.
May you be blessed by Yahweh,
who made heaven and earth.
The heavens belong to Yahweh;
but the earth he has given to mankind.
The dead do not praise Yahweh,
nor do any who go down into silence;
But we will bless Yahweh
now and forevermore.
Praise Yahweh.
v 1
I love Yahweh because he hears
my voice and my pleas for mercy.
v 2
Because he listened to me,
I will call on him as long as I live.
v 3
The cords of death surrounded me,
and the snares of Sheol confronted me;
I felt anguish and sorrow.
v 4
Then I called on the name of Yahweh:
“Please Yahweh, rescue my life.”
v 5
Yahweh is merciful and fair;
our God is compassionate.
v 6
Yahweh protects the naive;
I was brought low, and he saved me.
v 7
My soul can return to its resting place,
for Yahweh has been good to me.
v 8
For you rescued my life from death,
my eyes from tears,
and my feet from stumbling.
v 9
I will serve Yahweh
in the land of the living.
I believed in him, even when I said,
“I am greatly afflicted.”
In my confusion I said,
“All men are liars.”
How can I repay Yahweh
for all his kindnesses to me?
I will raise the cup of salvation,
and call on the name of Yahweh.
I will fulfill my vows to Yahweh
in the presence of all his people.
Precious in the sight of Yahweh
is the death of his faithful ones.
Yahweh, indeed, I am your servant;
I am your servant, the son of your servant woman;
you have taken away my bonds.
I will offer to you the sacrifice of thanksgiving
and will call on the name of Yahweh.
I will fulfill my vows to Yahweh
in the presence of all his people,
in the courts of Yahweh’s house,
in your midst, Jerusalem.
Praise Yahweh.
v 1
Praise Yahweh, all you nations;
exalt him, all you peoples.
v 2
For his covenant faithfulness is great toward us,
and the trustworthiness of Yahweh endures forever.
Praise Yahweh.
v 1
Give thanks to Yahweh, for he is good,
for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.
v 2
Let Israel say,
“His covenant faithfulness endures forever.”
v 3
Let the house of Aaron say,
“His covenant faithfulness endures forever.”
v 4
Let the loyal followers of Yahweh say,
“His covenant faithfulness endures for ever.”
v 5
In my distress I called out to Yahweh;
Yahweh answered me and set me free.
v 6
Yahweh is with me; I will not be afraid;
what can man do to me?
v 7
Yahweh is on my side as my helper;
I will look in triumph on those who hate me.
v 8
It is better to take shelter in Yahweh
than to put confidence in man.
v 9
It is better to take refuge in Yahweh
than to put one’s trust in a princes.
All the nations surrounded me;
in Yahweh’s name I cut them off.
They surrounded me; yes, they surrounded me;
in Yahweh’s name I cut them off.
They surrounded me like bees;
they disappeared as quickly as fire among thorns;
in Yahweh’s name I cut them off.
They attacked me to knock me down,
but Yahweh helped me.
Yahweh is my strength and joy,
and he is the one who rescues me.
The joyful shout of victory is heard in the tents of the righteous;
the right hand of Yahweh conquers.
The right hand of Yahweh is exalted;
the right hand of Yahweh conquers.
I will not die, but live
and declare the deeds of Yahweh.
Yahweh has punished me harshly;
but he has not handed me over to death.
Open to me the gates of righteousness;
I will enter them and I will give thanks to Yahweh.
This is the gate of Yahweh;
the righteous enter through it.
I will give thanks to you, for you answered me,
and you have become my salvation.
The stone that the builders rejected
has become the cornerstone.
This is Yahweh’s doing;
it is marvelous in our eyes.
This is the day on which Yahweh has acted;
we will rejoice and be glad in it.
Please, Yahweh, give us victory!
Please, Yahweh, give us success!
Blessed is he who comes in the name of Yahweh;
we bless you from the house of Yahweh.
Yahweh is God, and he has given us light;
bind the sacrifice with cords to the horns of the altar.
You are my God, and I will give thanks to you;
you are my God; I will exalt you.
Oh, give thanks to Yahweh; for he is good;
for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.
ALEPH
v 1
Blessed are those whose ways are blameless,
who walk in the law of Yahweh.
v 2
Blessed are they who keep his solemn commands,
who seek him with all their heart.
v 3
They do no wrong;
they walk in his ways.
v 4
You have commanded us to keep your instructions
so that we should carefully observe them.
v 5
Oh, that I would be firmly established
in the observance of your statutes!
v 6
Then I would not be put to shame
when I think of all your commandments.
v 7
I will give thanks to you with an upright heart
when I learn your righteous decrees.
v 8
I will observe your statutes;
do not leave me alone.
BETH
v 9
How can a young person keep his path pure?
By obeying your word.
With my whole heart I seek you;
Do not let me stray from your commandments.
I have stored up your word in my heart
so that I might not sin against you.
Blessed you are, Yahweh;
teach me your statutes.
With my mouth I have declared
all the righteous decrees that you have revealed.
I rejoice in the way of your covenant decrees
more than in all riches.
I will meditate on your instructions
and pay attention to your ways.
I delight in your statutes;
I will not forget your word.
GIMEL
Be kind to your servant so that I may live
and keep your word.
Open my eyes so that I may see
marvelous things in your law.
I am a foreigner in the land;
do not hide your commandments from me.
My desires are crushed by the longing to know
your righteous decrees at all times.
You rebuke the proud, who are cursed,
who wander from your commandments.
Spare me from disgrace and humiliation,
for I have obeyed your covenant decrees.
Though rulers plot and slander me,
your servant meditates on your statutes.
Your covenant decrees are my delight,
and they are my counselors.
DALETH
My life clings to the dust!
Give me life by your word.
I told you my ways, and you answered me;
teach me your statutes.
Make me understand the ways of your instructions,
so that I can meditate on your wondrous teachings.
I am overwhelmed with grief!
Strengthen me by your word.
Turn from me the path of deceit;
graciously teach me your law.
I have chosen the way of faithfulness;
I have always kept your righteous decrees before me.
I cling to your covenant decrees;
Yahweh, do not let me be shamed.
I will run in the path of your commandments,
for you enlarge my heart to do so.
HE
Teach me, Yahweh, the way of your statutes,
and I will keep them to the end.
Give me understanding, and I will keep your law;
I will observe it with all my heart.
Guide me in the path of your commandments,
for I delight to walk in it.
Direct my heart toward your covenant decrees
and away from unrighteous gain.
Turn my eyes from looking at worthless things;
revive me in your ways.
Carry out for your servant your promise
that you made to those who honor you.
Take away the insults I dread,
for your righteous judgments are good.
See, I have longed for your instructions;
revive me in your righteousness.
VAV
Yahweh, give me your unfailing love—
your salvation, according to your promise;
then I will have a reply for the one who mocks me,
for I trust in your word.
Do not take the word of truth from my mouth,
for my hope is in your righteous decrees.
I will observe your law continually,
forever and ever.
I will walk securely,
for I seek your instructions.
I will speak of your solemn commands before kings
and will not be ashamed.
I delight in your commandments,
which I love dearly.
I will lift up my hands to your commandments, which I love;
I will meditate on your statutes.
ZAYIN
Call to mind your promise to your servant
because you have given me hope.
This is my comfort in my affliction:
that your promise has kept me alive.
The proud have scoffed at me,
yet I have not turned away from your law.
I have thought about your righteous decrees from ancient times, Yahweh,
and I comfort myself.
Hot anger has taken hold of me
because of the wicked who reject your law.
Your statutes have been my songs
in the house where I temporarily live.
I think about your name during the night, Yahweh,
and I keep your law.
This has been my practice
because I have observed your instructions.
HETH
Yahweh is my portion;
I have determined to observe your words.
I earnestly request your favor with my whole heart;
be merciful to me, as your word promised.
I examined my ways
and turned my feet to your covenant decrees.
I hurry and do not delay
to keep your commandments.
The cords of the wicked have ensnared me;
I have not forgotten your law.
At midnight I rise to give thanks to you
because of your righteous decrees.
I am a companion of all who honor you,
to all who observe your instructions.
The earth, Yahweh, is full of your covenant faithfulness;
teach me your statutes.
TETH
You have done good to your servant,
Yahweh, by means of your word.
Teach me proper discernment and understanding,
for I have believed in your commandments.
Before I was afflicted I went astray,
but now I observe your word.
You are good, and you are one who does good;
teach me your statutes.
The arrogant have smeared me with lies,
but I keep your instructions with my whole heart.
Their hearts are hardened,
but I delight in your law.
It is good for me that I have suffered
so that I would learn your statutes.
Instruction from your mouth is more precious to me
than thousands of pieces of gold and silver.
YOD
Your hands have made and fashioned me;
give me understanding so that I may learn your commandments.
Those who honor you will be glad when they see me
because I find hope in your word.
I know, Yahweh, that your decrees are just,
and that in faithfulness you afflicted me.
Let your covenant faithfulness comfort me,
as you promised your servant.
Show me compassion so that I may live,
for your law is my delight.
Let the proud be put to shame,
for they have slandered me;
but I will meditate on your instructions.
May those who honor you turn to me,
those who know your covenant decrees.
May my heart be blameless with respect to your statutes
so that I may not be put to shame.
KAPH
I faint with longing that you might rescue me!
I hope in your word.
My eyes long to see your promise;
when will you comfort me?
For I have become like a wineskin in the smoke;
I do not forget your statutes.
How long must your servant endure this;
when will you judge those who persecute me?
The proud have dug pits for me,
defying your law.
All your commandments are reliable;
those people persecute me wrongfully; help me.
They have almost made an end to me on earth,
but I do not reject your instructions.
By your steadfast love, keep me alive,
so that I may obey your commands.
LAMEDH
Yahweh, your word stands forever;
your word is established firmly in heaven.
Your faithfulness lasts for all generations;
you have established the earth, and it remains.
All things continue to this day, just as you said in your righteous decrees,
for all things are your servants.
If your law had not been my delight,
I would have perished in my affliction.
I will never forget your instructions,
for through them you have kept me alive.
I am yours; save me,
for I seek your instructions.
The wicked prepare to destroy me,
but I will seek to understand your covenant decrees.
I have seen that everything has its limits,
but your commandments are broad, beyond limits.
MEM
Oh how I love your law!
It is my meditation all day long.
Your commandments make me wiser than my enemies,
for your commandments are always with me.
I have more understanding than all my teachers,
for I meditate on your covenant decrees.
I understand more than those older than I am;
this is because I have kept your instructions.
I have kept my feet back from every evil path
so that I might observe your word.
I have not turned aside from your righteous decrees,
for you have instructed me.
How sweet are your words to my taste,
yes, sweeter than honey to my mouth!
Through your instructions I gain discernment;
therefore I hate every false way.
NUN
Your word is a lamp to my feet
and a light for my path.
I have sworn and have confirmed it,
that I will observe your righteous decrees.
I am very afflicted;
keep me alive, Yahweh, as you have promised in your word.
Yahweh, please accept the freewill offerings of my mouth,
and teach me your righteous decrees.
My life is always in my hand,
yet I do not forget your law.
The wicked have set a snare for me,
but I have not strayed from your instructions.
I claim your covenant decrees as my heritage forever,
for they are the joy of my heart.
My heart is set on obeying your statutes
forever to the very end.
SAMEKH
I hate those who have a double mind,
but I love your law.
You are my hiding place and my shield;
I hope in your word.
Get away from me, you evil doers,
so that I may observe the commandments of my God.
Sustain me by your word so that I may live
and not be ashamed of my hope.
Support me, and I will be safe;
I will always meditate on your statutes.
You reject all those who stray from your statutes,
for those people are deceptive and unreliable.
You remove all the wicked of the earth like slag;
therefore I love your solemn commands.
My body trembles in fear of you,
and I am afraid of your righteous decrees.
AYIN
I do what is just and right;
do not abandon me to my oppressors.
Guarantee the welfare of your servant;
do not let the proud oppress me.
My eyes grow tired as I wait for your salvation
and for your righteous word.
Show your servant your covenant faithfulness,
and teach me your statutes.
I am your servant; give me understanding
so that I may know your covenant decrees.
It is time for Yahweh to act,
for people have broken your law.
Truly I love your commandments
more than gold, more than fine gold.
Therefore I carefully follow all your instructions,
and I hate every path of falsehood.
PE
Your rules are wonderful,
that is why I obey them.
The unfolding of your words gives light;
it gives understanding to the untrained.
I open my mouth and pant,
for I long for your commandments.
Turn to me and have mercy on me,
as you always do for those who love your name.
Direct my footsteps by your word;
do not let any sin rule me.
Redeem me from human oppression
so that I may observe your instructions.
Let your face shine on your servant,
and teach me your statutes.
Streams of tears run down from my eyes
because people do not observe your law.
TSADHE
You are righteous, Yahweh,
and your decrees are fair.
You have given your covenant decrees righteously
and faithfully.
Anger has destroyed me
because my adversaries forget your words.
Your word has been tested very much,
and your servant loves it.
I am insignificant and despised,
yet I do not forget your instructions.
Your justice is forever right,
and your law is trustworthy.
Though distress and anguish have found me,
your commandments are still my delight.
Your covenant decrees are righteous forever;
give me understanding that I may live.
QOPH
I cried out with my whole heart, “Answer me, Yahweh,
I will keep your statutes.
I call to you; save me,
and I will observe your covenant decrees.”
I rise before the dawn of the morning and cry for help.
I hope in your words.
My eyes are open before the night watches change
so that I might meditate on your word.
Hear my voice in your covenant faithfulness;
keep me alive, Yahweh, as you have promised in your righteous decrees.
Those who are persecuting me are coming closer to me,
but they are far from your law.
You are near, Yahweh,
and all your commandments are trustworthy.
Long ago I learned from your covenant decrees
that you had set them in place forever.
RESH
Look on my affliction and help me,
for I do not forget your law.
Plead my cause and redeem me;
keep me, as you have promised in your word.
Salvation is far from the wicked,
for they do not love your statutes.
Great are your merciful actions, Yahweh;
keep me alive, as you always do.
My persecutors and my foes are many,
yet I have not turned from your covenant decrees.
I view the treacherous with disgust
because they do not keep your word.
See how I love your instructions;
keep me alive, Yahweh, as you have promised by your covenant faithfulness.
The essence of your word is truth;
every one of your righteous decrees lasts forever.
SHIN
Princes persecute me without cause,
but my heart stands in awe of your word.
I rejoice at your word
like one who finds great plunder.
I hate and despise falsehood,
but I love your law.
Seven times a day I praise you
because of your righteous decrees.
Great peace they have, those who love your law;
nothing makes them stumble.
I hope for your salvation, Yahweh,
and I obey your commandments.
I observe your solemn commands,
and I love them greatly.
I keep your instructions and your solemn commands,
for you are aware of everything I do.
TAV
Listen to my cry for help, Yahweh;
give me understanding into your word.
May my plea come before you;
help me, as you have promised in your word.
May my lips pour out praise,
for you teach me your statutes.
Let my tongue sing about your word,
for all your commandments are right.
May your hand help me,
for I have chosen your instructions.
I long for your rescue, Yahweh,
and your law is my delight.
May I live and praise you,
and may your righteous decrees help me.
I have wandered off like a lost sheep;
seek your servant,
for I have not forgotten your commandments.
A song of ascents.
v 1
In my distress I called out to Yahweh,
and he answered me.
v 2
Rescue my life, Yahweh, from those who lie with their lips
and deceive with their tongues.
v 3
How will he punish you, and what more will he do to you,
you who have a lying tongue?
v 4
He will punish you with the arrows of a warrior
sharpened over burning coals of the broom tree.
v 5
Woe is me because I temporarily live in Meshech;
I lived previously among the tents of Kedar.
v 6
For too long I have lived
with those who hate peace.
v 7
I am for peace,
but when I speak, they are for war.
A song of ascents.
v 1
I will lift up my eyes to the mountains.
From where will my help come?
v 2
My help comes from Yahweh,
who made heaven and earth.
v 3
He will not allow your foot to slip;
he who protects you will not slumber.
v 4
See, the guardian of Israel
never slumbers or sleeps.
v 5
Yahweh is your guardian;
Yahweh is the shade at your right hand.
v 6
The sun will not harm you by day,
nor the moon by night.
v 7
Yahweh will protect you from all harm,
and he will protect your life.
v 8
Yahweh will protect you in all you do
now and forevermore.
A song of ascents, of David.
v 1
I was glad when they said to me,
“Let us go to the house of Yahweh.”
v 2
Jerusalem, our feet are standing
within your gates!
v 3
Jerusalem, built
as a city carefully planned!
v 4
The tribes go up to Jerusalem—the tribes of Yahweh—
as a testimony for Israel,
to give thanks to the name of Yahweh.
v 5
There thrones of judgment were set,
thrones of the house of David.
v 6
Pray for the peace of Jerusalem!
“May those who love you have peace.
v 7
May there be peace within the walls that defend you,
and may they have peace within your fortresses.”
v 8
For the sake of my brothers and my friends
I will say, “May there be peace within you.”
v 9
For the sake of the house of Yahweh our God,
I will seek good for you.
A song of ascents.
v 1
To you I lift up my eyes,
you who are enthroned in the heavens.
v 2
See, as the eyes of servants look to their master’s hand,
as the eyes of a maid look to her mistress’s hand,
so our eyes look to Yahweh our God
until he has mercy on us.
v 3
Have mercy on us, Yahweh, have mercy on us,
for we are filled with humiliation.
v 4
We are more than full
of the scoffing of the insolent
and with the contempt of the proud.
A song of ascents; of David.
v 1
“If Yahweh had not been on our side,”
let Israel say now,
v 2
“if it had not been Yahweh who was on our side
when men rose up against us,
v 3
then they would have swallowed us up alive
when their anger raged against us.
v 4
The water would have swept us away;
the torrent would have overwhelmed us.
v 5
Then the raging waters would have drowned us.”
v 6
Blessed be Yahweh,
who has not allowed us to be torn by their teeth.
v 7
We have escaped like a bird out of the snare of the fowlers;
the snare has been broken, and we have escaped.
v 8
Our help is in Yahweh,
who made heaven and earth.
A song of ascents.
v 1
Those who trust in Yahweh
are like Mount Zion, unshakable, forever enduring.
v 2
As the mountains surround Jerusalem,
so Yahweh surrounds his people
now and forever.
v 3
The scepter of wickedness must not rule in the land of the righteous.
Otherwise the righteous might do what is wrong.
v 4
Do good, Yahweh, to those who are good
and to those who are upright in their hearts.
v 5
But as for those who turn aside to their crooked ways,
Yahweh will lead them away with the evildoers.
May peace be on Israel.
A song of ascents.
v 1
When Yahweh restored the fortunes of Zion,
we were like those who dream.
v 2
Then our mouths were filled with laughter
and our tongues with singing.
Then they said among the nations,
“Yahweh has done great things for them.”
v 3
Yahweh did great things for us;
how glad we were!
v 4
Restore our fortunes, Yahweh,
like the streams in the Negev.
v 5
Those who sow in tears will reap with shouts of joy.
v 6
He who goes out weeping, carrying seed for sowing,
will return again with shouts of joy, bringing his bundles of grain with him.
A song of ascents, of Solomon.
v 1
Unless Yahweh builds the house,
they work uselessly, those who build it.
Unless Yahweh guards the city,
the watchman stands guard uselessly.
v 2
It is useless for you to rise up early,
to come home late,
or to eat the bread of hard work,
for Yahweh provides for his beloved as they sleep.
v 3
See, children are a heritage from Yahweh,
and the fruit of the womb is a reward from him.
v 4
Like arrows in the hand of a warrior,
so are the children of one’s youth.
v 5
How blessed is the man that has his quiver full of them.
He will not be put to shame
when he confronts his enemies in the gate.
A song of ascents.
v 1
Blessed is everyone who honors Yahweh,
who walks in his ways.
v 2
What your hands provide, you will enjoy;
you will be blessed and prosper.
v 3
Your wife will be like a fruitful vine
in your house;
your children will be like olive plants
as they sit around your table.
v 4
Yes, indeed, the man will be blessed
who honors Yahweh.
v 5
May Yahweh bless you from Zion;
may you see the prosperity of Jerusalem all the days of your life.
v 6
May you live to see your children’s children.
May peace be on Israel.
A song of ascents.
v 1
“Often since my youth they have attacked me,”
let Israel say.
v 2
“Often since my youth they have attacked me,
yet they have not defeated me.
v 3
The plowers plowed on my back;
they made their furrows long.
v 4
Yahweh is righteous;
he has cut the ropes of the wicked.”
v 5
May they all be put to shame and turned back,
those who hate Zion.
v 6
May they be like the grass on the housetops
that withers before it grows up,
v 7
that cannot fill the reaper’s hand
or the chest of the one who binds bundles of grain together.
v 8
May those who pass by not say,
“May the blessing of Yahweh be on you;
we bless you in the name of Yahweh.”
A song of ascents.
v 1
Out of the depths I cry to you, Yahweh.
v 2
Lord, hear my voice;
let your ears be attentive
to my pleas for mercy.
v 3
If you, Yahweh, would mark iniquities,
Lord, who could stand?
v 4
But there is forgiveness with you,
that you may be revered.
v 5
I wait for Yahweh, my soul waits,
and in his word I hope.
v 6
My soul waits for the Lord
more than watchmen wait for the morning.
v 7
Israel, hope in Yahweh.
Yahweh is merciful,
and he is very willing to forgive.
v 8
It is he who will redeem Israel
from all his sins.
A song of ascents; of David.
v 1
Yahweh, my heart is not proud or my eyes haughty.
I do not have great hopes for myself
or concern myself with things that are beyond me.
v 2
Indeed I have stilled and quieted my soul;
like a weaned child with his mother,
my soul within me is like a weaned child.
v 3
Israel, hope in Yahweh
now and forever.
A song of ascents.
v 1
Yahweh, for David’s sake call to mind
all his afflictions.
v 2
Call to mind how he swore to Yahweh,
how he vowed to the Mighty One of Jacob.
v 3
He said, “I will not enter my house
or get into my bed,
v 4
I will not give sleep to my eyes
or rest to my eyelids
v 5
until I find a place for Yahweh,
a tabernacle for the Mighty One of Jacob.”
v 6
See, we heard about it in Ephrathah;
we found it in the fields of Jaar.
v 7
We will go into God’s tabernacle;
we will worship at his footstool.
v 8
Arise, Yahweh, to your resting place,
you and the ark of your strength!
v 9
May your priests be clothed with integrity;
may your faithful ones shout for joy.
For your servant David’s sake,
do not turn away from your anointed king.
Yahweh swore a sure oath to David,
a sure oath that he will not revoke:
“I will place one of your descendants on your throne.
If your sons keep my covenant
and the laws that I will teach them,
their children also will sit on your throne forevermore.”
Certainly Yahweh has chosen Zion,
he has desired her for his seat.
“This is my resting place forever.
I will live here, for I desire her.
I will abundantly bless her with provisions.
I will satisfy her poor with bread.
I will clothe her priests with salvation,
her faithful ones will shout aloud for joy.
There I will make a horn to sprout for David
and set up a lamp for my anointed one.
I will clothe his enemies with shame,
but on him his crown will shine.”
A song of ascents, of David.
v 1
Behold, how good and how pleasant it is
for brothers to live together!
v 2
It is like fine oil on the head
pouring down on the beard—
Aaron’s beard,
and then it pours down on the collar of his robes.
v 3
It is like the dew of Hermon
which falls on the mountains of Zion.
For there Yahweh commanded the blessing—
life forevermore.
A song of ascents.
v 1
Come, bless Yahweh, all you servants of Yahweh,
you who serve during the night in Yahweh’s house.
v 2
Lift up your hands to the holy place
and bless Yahweh.
v 3
May Yahweh bless you from Zion,
he who made heaven and earth.
v 1
Praise Yahweh.
Praise the name of Yahweh.
Praise him, you servants of Yahweh,
v 2
you who stand in Yahweh’s house,
in the courtyards of the house of our God.
v 3
Praise Yahweh, for he is good;
sing praises to his name, for it is pleasant to do so.
v 4
For Yahweh has chosen Jacob for himself,
Israel as his possession.
v 5
I know that Yahweh is great,
that our Lord is above all gods.
v 6
Whatever Yahweh desires, he does
in heaven, on earth, in the seas and all the ocean depths.
v 7
He brings the clouds from far away,
making lightning bolts accompany the rain
and bringing the wind out of his storehouse.
v 8
He killed the firstborn of Egypt,
both of man and animals.
v 9
He sent signs and wonders into your midst, Egypt,
against Pharaoh and all his servants.
He attacked many nations
and killed mighty kings,
Sihon king of the Amorites
and Og king of Bashan
and all the kingdoms of Canaan.
He gave us their land as an inheritance,
an inheritance to Israel his people.
Your name, Yahweh, endures forever;
your renown, Yahweh, endures throughout all generations.
For Yahweh defends his people
and has compassion on his servants.
The nations’ idols are silver and gold,
the work of men’s hands.
Those idols have mouths, but they do not speak;
they have eyes, but they do not see;
they have ears, but they do not hear,
nor is there breath in their mouths.
Those who make them are like them,
as is everyone who trusts in them.
Descendants of Israel, bless Yahweh;
descendants of Aaron, bless Yahweh.
Descendants of Levi, bless Yahweh;
you who honor Yahweh, bless Yahweh.
Blessed be Yahweh in Zion,
he who lives in Jerusalem.
Praise Yahweh.
v 1
Oh, give thanks to Yahweh; for he is good,
for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.
v 2
Oh, give thanks to the God of gods,
for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.
v 3
Oh, give thanks to the Lord of lords,
for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.
v 4
Give thanks to him who alone does great wonders,
for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—
v 5
to him who by wisdom made the heavens,
for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.
v 6
Give thanks to him who spread out the earth above the waters,
for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—
v 7
to him who made great lights,
for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.
v 8
Give thank to him who gave the sun to rule by day,
for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—
v 9
the moon and stars to rule by night,
for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.
Give thanks to him who killed the firstborn of Egypt,
for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—
and brought out Israel from among them,
for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—
with a strong hand and a raised arm,
for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.
Give thanks to him who divided the Sea of Reeds,
for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—
and made Israel to pass through the middle of it,
for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—
but overthrew Pharaoh and his army in the Sea of Reeds,
for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.
Give thanks to him who led his people through the wilderness,
for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—
to him who killed great kings,
for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.
Give thanks to him who killed famous kings,
for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—
Sihon king of the Amorites,
for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—
and Og king of Bashan,
for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.
Give thanks to him who gave their land as an inheritance,
for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—
an inheritance to Israel his servant,
for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—
to him who called us to mind and helped us in our humiliation,
for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.
Give thanks to him who has given us victory over our enemies,
for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—
who gives food to all living beings,
for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.
Oh, give thanks to the God of heaven,
for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.
v 1
By the rivers of Babylon
we sat down and wept
when we thought about Zion.
v 2
On the poplars there
we hung our harps.
v 3
There our captors required songs from us,
and those who mocked us required us to be happy, saying,
“Sing us one of the songs of Zion.”
v 4
How could we sing a song about Yahweh
in a foreign land?
v 5
If I ignore the memory of you, Jerusalem,
let my right hand forget her skill.
v 6
Let my tongue cling to the roof of my mouth
if I think about you no more,
if I do not prefer Jerusalem
more than my greatest delights.
v 7
Call to mind, Yahweh, what the Edomites did
on the day Jerusalem fell.
They said, “Tear it down, tear it down
to its foundations.”
v 8
Daughter of Babylon, soon to be destroyed—
may the person be blessed, whoever pays you back
for what you have done to us.
v 9
May the person be blessed, whoever takes and dashes your little ones
against a rock.
A psalm of David.
v 1
I will give you thanks with my whole heart;
before the gods I will sing praises to you.
v 2
I will bow down toward your holy temple
and give thanks to your name for your covenant faithfulness and for your trustworthiness.
You have made your word and your name more important than anything else.
v 3
On the day that I called you, you answered me;
you made me bold and strengthened my soul.
v 4
All the kings of the earth will give you thanks, Yahweh,
for they will hear the words from your mouth.
v 5
Indeed, they will sing of the deeds of Yahweh,
for great is the glory of Yahweh.
v 6
For though Yahweh is high, yet he cares for the lowly,
but the proud he knows from far off.
v 7
Though I walk in the middle of danger, you will preserve my life;
you will reach out with your hand against the anger of my enemies,
and your right hand will save me.
v 8
Yahweh is with me to the end;
your covenant faithfulness, Yahweh, endures forever.
Do not forsake the ones whom your hands have made.
For the chief musician. A psalm of David.
v 1
Yahweh, you have examined me, and you know me.
v 2
You know when I sit down and when I get up;
you understand my thoughts from far away.
v 3
You observe my path and my lying down;
you are familiar with all my ways.
v 4
For before there is a word on my tongue,
you know it completely, Yahweh.
v 5
Behind me and before me you surround me
and place your hand upon me.
v 6
Such knowledge is too much for me;
it is too high, and I cannot reach it.
v 7
Where can I go from your Spirit?
Where can I flee from your presence?
v 8
If I ascend up to the heavens, you are there;
if I make my bed in Sheol, behold, you are there.
v 9
If I fly away on the wings of the morning
and go to live in the uttermost parts across the sea,
even there your hand will lead me,
your right hand will hold on to me.
If I said, “Surely the darkness will cover me,
and the light will become night around me,”
even the darkness would not be dark to you.
The night would shine like the day,
for the darkness and the light are both alike to you.
You formed my inner parts;
you formed me in my mother’s womb.
I will praise you,
for I am wonderfully made.
My soul knows this very well.
My bones were not hidden from you
when I was made in private,
when I was intricately made in the depths of the earth.
You saw me inside the womb;
all the days assigned to me were recorded
in your book even before the first one happened.
How precious are your thoughts to me, God!
How vast is their sum!
If I tried to count them, they would be more in number than the sand.
When I awake, I am still with you.
If only you would kill the wicked, God;
get away from me, you violent men.
They rebel against you and act deceitfully;
your enemies tell lies.
Do I not hate those, Yahweh, who hate you?
Do I not despise those who rise up against you?
I hate them completely;
they have become my enemies.
Examine me, God, and know my heart;
test me and know my thoughts.
See if there is any wicked way in me,
and lead me in the everlasting way.
For the chief musician. A psalm of David.
v 1
Yahweh, rescue me from the wicked;
preserve me from violent men.
v 2
They plan evil in their hearts;
they cause battles every day.
v 3
Their tongues wound like serpents;
vipers’ poison is on their lips.
Selah
v 4
Keep me from the hands of the wicked, Yahweh;
preserve me from violent men
who plan to knock me over.
v 5
The proud have set a trap for me;
they have spread a net;
they have set a snare for me.
Selah
v 6
I said to Yahweh, “You are my God;
listen to my cries for mercy.”
v 7
Yahweh, my Lord, you are powerfully able to save me;
you shield my head in the day of battle.
v 8
Yahweh, do not grant the desires of the wicked;
do not let their plots succeed.
Selah
v 9
Those who surround me raise their heads;
let the mischief of their own lips cover them.
Let burning coals fall on them;
throw them into the fire,
into bottomless pits, never more to rise.
May men of tongues not be made secure on the earth;
may evil hunt down the violent man to strike him dead.
I know that Yahweh will judge in favor of the afflicted,
and that he will give justice to the needy.
Surely the righteous people will give thanks to your name;
the upright people will live in your presence.
A psalm of David.
v 1
Yahweh, I am crying out to you; come quickly to me.
Listen to me when I call to you.
v 2
May my prayer be like incense before you;
may my lifted hands be like the evening sacrifice.
v 3
Yahweh, place a guard over my mouth;
guard the door of my lips.
v 4
Do not let my heart desire any evil thing
or participate in sinful activities
with men who behave wickedly.
May I not eat any of their delicacies.
v 5
Let a righteous man hit me; it will be a kindness to me.
Let him correct me; it will be like oil on my head;
may my head not refuse to accept it.
But my prayer is always against their wicked deeds.
v 6
Their leaders will be thrown down from the top of cliffs;
they will hear that my own words are pleasant.
v 7
They will have to say, “As when one plows and breaks up the ground,
so our bones have been scattered at the mouth of Sheol.”
v 8
Surely my eyes are on you, Yahweh, Lord;
in you I take refuge; do not leave my soul defenseless.
v 9
Protect me from the snares that they have laid for me,
from the traps of evildoers.
Let the wicked fall into their own nets
while I escape.
A maschil of David, when he was in the cave; a prayer.
v 1
With my voice I cry out for help to Yahweh;
with my voice I plead for Yahweh’s favor.
v 2
I pour out my lament before him;
I tell him my troubles.
v 3
When my spirit is weak within me,
you know my path.
In the way that I walk
they have hidden a trap for me.
v 4
I look to my right and see
that there is no one who cares about me.
There is no escape for me;
no one cares about my life.
v 5
I called out to you, Yahweh;
I said, “You are my refuge,
my portion in the land of the living.
v 6
Listen to my call,
for I have been brought very low;
rescue me from my persecutors,
for they are stronger than I.
v 7
Bring my soul out of prison
so that I may give thanks to your name.
The righteous will gather around me
because you have been good to me.”
A psalm of David.
v 1
Hear my prayer, Yahweh; listen to my pleas.
Because of your faithfulness and righteousness, answer me!
v 2
Do not enter into judgment with your servant,
for in your sight no one is righteous.
v 3
The enemy has pursued my soul;
he has crushed me to the ground;
he has made me to live in darkness
like those who have been dead a long time.
v 4
My spirit is overwhelmed within me;
my heart despairs.
v 5
I call to mind the old days;
I meditate on all your deeds;
I reflect on your accomplishments.
v 6
I spread my hands out to you;
my soul thirsts for you in a parched land.
Selah
v 7
Answer me quickly, Yahweh, because my spirit faints.
Do not hide your face from me,
or I will become like those who go down into the pit.
v 8
Let me hear your covenant faithfulness in the morning,
for I trust in you.
Show me the way where I should walk,
for I lift up my soul to you.
v 9
Rescue me from my enemies, Yahweh;
I flee to you to hide.
Teach me to do your will,
for you are my God.
May your good Spirit
lead me in the land of uprightness.
Yahweh, for your name’s sake, keep me alive;
in your righteousness bring my soul out of trouble.
In your covenant faithfulness cut off my enemies
and destroy all the enemies of my life,
for I am your servant.
A psalm of David.
v 1
Blessed be Yahweh, my rock,
who trains my hands for war
and my fingers for battle.
v 2
You are my covenant faithfulness and my fortress,
my high tower and the one who rescues me,
my shield and the one in whom I take refuge,
the one who subdues nations under me.
v 3
Yahweh, what is man that you take notice of him
or the son of man that you think about him?
v 4
Man is like a breath;
his days are like a passing shadow.
v 5
Cause the sky to sink and come down, Yahweh;
touch the mountains and make them smoke.
v 6
Send flashes of lightning and scatter my enemies;
shoot your arrows and drive them back in confusion.
v 7
Reach out your hand from above;
rescue me out of many waters,
from the hand of foreigners.
v 8
Their mouths speak lies,
and their right hand is falsehood.
v 9
I will sing a new song to you, God;
on a lute of ten strings I will sing praises to you,
who give salvation to kings,
who rescued David your servant from an evil sword.
Rescue me and free me from the hand of foreigners.
Their mouths speak lies,
and their right hand is falsehood.
May our sons be like plants who grow to full size in their youth
and our daughters like carved corner pillars, shapely like those of a palace.
May our storehouses be full with every kind of produce,
and may our sheep produce thousands and ten thousands in our fields.
Then our oxen will have many young.
No one will break through our walls; there will be no exile
and no outcry in our streets.
Blessed is the people with such blessings;
happy is the people whose God is Yahweh.
A psalm of praise. Of David.
v 1
I will extol you, my God, King;
I will bless your name forever and ever.
v 2
Every day will I bless you;
I will praise your name forever and ever.
v 3
Great is Yahweh and greatly to be praised;
his greatness is unsearchable.
v 4
One generation will praise your deeds to the next
and will proclaim your mighty actions.
v 5
I will meditate on the majesty of your glory
and on your marvelous deeds.
v 6
They will speak of the power of your awesome works,
and I will declare your greatness.
v 7
They will declare your abounding goodness,
and they will sing about your righteousness.
v 8
Yahweh is gracious and merciful,
slow to anger and abounding in covenant faithfulness.
v 9
Yahweh is good to all;
his tender mercies are over all his works.
All you have made will give thanks to you, Yahweh;
your faithful ones will bless you.
They will speak of the glory of your kingdom,
and they will tell of your power.
They will make known to mankind God’s mighty deeds
and the glorious splendor of his kingdom.
Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom,
and your dominion endures throughout all generations.
Yahweh supports all who are falling
and raises up all those who are bent over.
The eyes of all wait for you;
you give them their food at the right time.
You open your hand
and satisfy the desire of every living thing.
Yahweh is righteous in all his ways
and faithful in all he does.
Yahweh is near to all those who call to him,
to all who call to him in trustworthiness.
He fulfills the desire of those who honor him;
he hears their cry and saves them.
Yahweh watches over all those who love him,
but he will destroy all the wicked.
My mouth will speak out the praise of Yahweh;
let all mankind bless his holy name forever and ever.
v 1
Praise Yahweh.
Praise Yahweh, my soul.
v 2
I give praise to Yahweh with all my life;
I will sing praises to my God as long as I exist.
v 3
Do not put your trust in princes
or in mankind, in whom there is no salvation.
v 4
When a person’s life’s breath stops, he returns to the ground;
on that day his plans end.
v 5
Blessed is he who has the God of Jacob for his help,
whose hope is in Yahweh his God.
v 6
Yahweh made heaven and earth,
the sea, and all that is in them;
he observes trustworthiness forever.
v 7
He executes justice for the oppressed
and gives food to the hungry.
Yahweh frees the prisoners;
v 8
Yahweh opens the eyes of the blind;
Yahweh raises up those who are bowed down;
Yahweh loves the righteous people.
v 9
Yahweh protects the foreigners in the land;
he lifts up the fatherless and widow,
but he opposes the wicked.
Yahweh will reign forever,
your God, Zion, for all generations.
Praise Yahweh.
v 1
Praise Yahweh,
for it is good to sing praises to our God,
it is pleasant, and praise is suitable.
v 2
Yahweh rebuilds Jerusalem,
he gathers together the scattered people of Israel.
v 3
He heals the brokenhearted
and binds up their wounds.
v 4
He counts the stars,
he gives names to all of them.
v 5
Great is our Lord and awesome in power,
his understanding cannot be measured.
v 6
Yahweh lifts up the oppressed,
he brings the wicked down to the ground.
v 7
Sing to Yahweh with thanksgiving,
sing praises to our God with a harp.
v 8
He covers the heavens with clouds
and prepares rain for the earth,
making the grass to grow on the mountains.
v 9
He gives food to the animals
and to the young ravens when they cry.
He finds no delight in the strength of a horse,
he takes no pleasure in the strong legs of a man.
Yahweh takes pleasure in those who honor him,
who hope in his covenant faithfulness.
Praise Yahweh, Jerusalem,
praise your God, Zion.
For he strengthens the bars of your gates,
he blesses your children among you.
He brings prosperity inside your borders,
he satisfies you with the finest of wheat.
He sends out his commandment to earth,
his command runs very swiftly.
He makes the snow like wool,
he scatters the frost like ashes.
He dispenses the hail like crumbs,
who can withstand the cold he sends?
He sends out his command and melts them,
he makes the wind to blow and the water to flow.
He proclaimed his word to Jacob,
his statutes and his righteous decrees to Israel.
He has not done so with any other nation,
and as for his decrees, they do not know them.
Praise Yahweh.
v 1
Praise Yahweh.
Praise Yahweh, you in the heavens;
praise him, you in the heights.
v 2
Praise him, all his angels;
praise him, all his hosts.
v 3
Praise him, sun and moon;
praise him, all you shining stars.
v 4
Praise him, highest heaven
and you waters that are above the sky.
v 5
Let them praise the name of Yahweh,
for he gave the command, and they were created.
v 6
He has also established them forever and ever;
he issued a decree that will never change.
v 7
Praise him from the earth,
you sea monsters and all ocean depths,
v 8
fire and hail, snow and clouds,
stormy wind fulfilling his word.
v 9
Praise him, mountains and all hills,
fruit trees and all cedars,
animals wild and tame,
creatures that crawl and birds.
Praise Yahweh, kings of the earth and all nations,
princes and all who govern on the earth,
both young men and young women,
elderly and children.
Let them all praise the name of Yahweh,
for his name alone is exalted
and his glory extends over the earth and the heavens.
He has lifted up the horn of his people
for praise from all his faithful ones,
the Israelites, the people near to him.
Praise Yahweh.
v 1
Praise Yahweh.
Sing to Yahweh a new song;
sing his praise in the assembly of the faithful ones.
v 2
Let Israel rejoice in the one who made them;
let the people of Zion rejoice in their king.
v 3
Let them praise his name with dancing;
let them sing praises to him with tambourine and harp.
v 4
For Yahweh takes pleasure in his people;
he glorifies the humble with salvation.
v 5
Let the faithful ones rejoice in this honor;
let them sing for joy on their beds.
v 6
May the praises of God be in their mouths
and a two-edged sword in their hand
v 7
to execute vengeance on the nations
and acts of punishment on the peoples.
v 8
They will bind their kings with chains
and their nobles with iron shackles.
v 9
They will execute the judgment that is written.
This will be an honor for all his faithful ones.
Praise Yahweh.
v 1
Praise Yahweh.
Praise God in his holy place;
praise him in the mighty heavens.
v 2
Praise him for his mighty acts;
praise him for his surpassing greatness.
v 3
Praise him with the blast of the horn;
praise him with lute and harp.
v 4
Praise him with tambourines and dancing;
praise him with stringed instruments and wind instruments.
v 5
Praise him with loud cymbals;
praise him with high sounding cymbals.
v 6
Let everything that has breath praise Yahweh.
Praise Yahweh.
